FOOTNOTE TO FORM ADV, ITEM 1.A AND ITEM 3.A: NATIONAL VENTURE DEVELOPMENT (NVD) IS A BUSINESS UNIT OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC- SERIES A ("PF-A").  NVD FUNCTIONS AS AN OPERATING COMPANY TO PROVIDE INVESTMENT ADVICE TO THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC - SERIES C THROUGH SERIES J, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS, AND KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC - SERIES A & B.  INDIVIDUALS WORKING WITHIN NVD ARE EMPLOYEES OF PF-A AND THE EMPLOYMENT RELATED COSTS OF SUCH INDIVIDUALS ARE SHARED BY PF-A AND KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS.  NVD WAS CREATED TO GIVE ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE TO ACTIVITIES THAT ARE UNRELATED TO THE MEDICAL CARE PROVIDED BY THE MEMBERS OF PF-A AND KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS AND ITS AFFILIATES. THE SERIES A MEMBERS OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC, WHICH IS A DELAWARE SERIES LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY, ARE PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL CORPORATIONS AND A PARTNERSHIP LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES THAT PROVIDE MEDICAL AND RELATED SERVICES TO KAISER PERMANENTE MEMBERS AND PATIENTS.  SERIES A WAS FORMED IN 2002, AND IS THE SERIES UNDER WHICH ADMINISTRATIVE AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO ITS MEMBERS. AS NOTED ABOVE, INDIVIDUALS WORKING IN NVD ARE EMPLOYEES OF PF-A.  STARTING IN 2000, SEPARATE SERIES (SERIES C - J) (THE "PF INVESTMENT SERIES") HAVE BEEN CREATED TO PROVIDE POOLED INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE ENTITY MEMBERS OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC TO INVEST IN COMPANIES THAT PROVIDE INNOVATIVE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES IN THE HEALTH CARE INDUSTRY. STARTING IN 2000, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS HAS ALSO MADE INVESTMENTS IN HEALTH CARE RELATED COMPANIES, TYPICALLY INVESTING IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.   IN 2009, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS CREATED A FUND, KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES, LLC - SERIES A, WHICH IS A SERIES LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY UNDER DELAWARE LAW, AND THROUGH WHICH IT MAKES INVESTMENTS IN HEALTH CARE RELATED COMPANIES, AGAIN TYPICALLY IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.  IN 2010, KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC - SERIES B WAS FORMED TO FACILITATE THE INVESTMENT BY ENTITIES OTHER THAN KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS AND THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.  KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES - SERIES A AND SERIES B INVEST IN TANDEM, AND, AS NOTED ABOVE, TYPICALLY INVEST IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES. THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC AND KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC EACH HAVE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEES, IN THE CASE OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC WHOSE MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE MEMBERS OF SERIES A, AND IN THE CASE OF KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC WHOSE MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS.  THESE COMMITTEES ACT UPON INVESTMENT RECOMMENDATIONS OF NVD STAFF.

FURTHERMORE, REGARDING SUCH FUNDS AND FOR PURPOSES OF THESE CALCULATIONS, WE HAVE AGGREGATED ALL TRANCHES OF INTERESTS ISSUED BY SUCH FUNDS. WITH RESPECT TO THE SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS AND FUGU CREDIT PLC, WE HAVE CALCULATED GROSS ASSETS ON THE BASIS OF THE BALANCE SHEETS OF SUCH FUNDS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGE HELD BY OUR AFFILIATE IN EACH SUCH FUND USING THE PAR VALUE OF THE NOTES HELD BY IT DIVIDED BY THE TOTAL PAR VALUE OF THE OUTSTANDING NOTES ISSUED BY THE RELEVANT FUND.  WITH RESPECT TO ALMACK I MEZZANINE LP, ALMACK II UNLEVERAGED LP AND ALMACK MEZZANINE III LP (THE "MEZZANINE FUNDS"), WE HAVE CALCULATED THE FUNDS' RESPECTIVE GROSS ASSETS BY VALUING DEBT ASSETS AT PAR PLUS ACCRUED INTEREST LESS IMPAIRMENTS AND EQUITY INVESTMENTS USING A MULTIPLES METHODOLOGY ON THE BASIS THAT THEY ARE HELD AT FAIR VALUE. THIS IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION (IPEVC) GUIDELINES, WHICH IS THE BASIS PRESCRIBED BY THE FUND DOCUMENTS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGES HELD BY THE VARIOUS CLASSES OF OWNER IN SUCH FUNDS BY REFERENCE TO THEIR ORIGINAL COMMITMENTS. EACH ERA AFFILIATE: (1) ACTS AS THE GENERAL PARTNER ONLY FOR PRIVATE FUNDS OR OTHER POOLED INVESTMENT VEHICLES ADVISED BY APPLICANT; (2) APPLICANT CONTROLS SUCH ERA AFFILIATE; (3) THE INVESTMENT ADVISORY ACTIVITIES OF SUCH ERA AFFILIATE ARE SUBJECT TO THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT OF 1940; (4) SUCH ERA AFFILIATE HAS NO EMPLOYEES OR OTHER PERSONS ACTING ON ITS BEHALF OTHER THAN OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, PARTNERS OR EMPLOYEES OF THE APPLICANT; AND (5) SUCH ERA AFFILIATE, ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, PARTNERS, EMPLOYEES AND PERSONS ACTING ON ITS BEHALF ARE SUBJECT TO APPLICANT'S SUPERVISION AND CONTROL AND ARE THEREFORE "PERSONS ASSOCIATED WITH" APPLICANT.  ALL RESPONSES IN THIS REPORT RELATE TO AND INCLUDE ALL INFORMATION CONCERNING APPLICANT AND SUCH ERA AFFILIATE. THE APPLICANT RECEIVES MANAGEMENT FEES FROM THE PARTNERSHIPS GENERALLY RANGING FROM 1.0% TO 2.5% PER ANNUM BASED ON EACH PARTNERSHIPS'S COMMITTED CAPITAL OR ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT.  MANAGEMENT FEES ARE PAYABLE IN ADVANCE ON A QUARTERLY BASIS.  IN ADDITION, THE APPLICANT IS AFFILIATED WITH EACH OF THE ENTITIES ACTING AS GENERAL PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS.  THE GENERAL PARTNER ENTITIES RECEIVE AS A PERFORMANCE FEE ALLOCATION A PORTION OF THE NET GAINS OF SUCH PARTNERSHIPS RANGING FROM 10% TO 25% OF SUCH GAINS.  SUCH PERFORMANCE FEE ALLOCATIONS ARE GENERALLY DISTRIBUTED TO THE GENERAL PARTNER OF A PARTNERSHIP AT THE SAME TIME SUCH DISTRIBUTIONS ARE MADE TO THE LIMITED PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS.  THE SPECIFIC TERMS OF SUCH PERFORMANCE ALLOCATIONS COMPLY WITH RULE 205-3 OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT AND EACH OF THE LIMITED PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS IS A "QUALIFIED CLIENT."

THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER IS THE INVESTMENT MANAGER OF COMGEST GROWTH PLC, AN OPEN-ENDED INVESTMENT COMPANY WITH VARIABLE CAPITAL ORGANISED UNDER THE LAWS OF IRELAND WHICH QUALIFIES AND IS AUTHORISED IN IRELAND BY THE CENTRAL BANK OF IRELAND AS A UCITS FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE UCITS REGULATIONS. COMGEST GROWTH PLC IS STRUCTURED AS AN UMBRELLA FUND WITH SEGREGATED LIABILITY BETWEEN FUNDS IN THAT THE SHARE CAPITAL OF THE COMPANY MAY BE DIVIDED INTO DIFFERENT CLASSES OF SHARES WITH ONE OR MORE CLASSES REPRESENTING A SEPARATE FUND OF THE COMPANY.  EACH FUND IS A SEGREGATED PORTFOLIO OF ASSETS AND WILL ACCORDINGLY BEAR ITS OWN LIABILITIES. WITH REGARD TO THIRD PARTIES, IN PARTICULAR THE COMPANY'S CREDITORS, THE COMPANY SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL LIABILITIES INCURRED BY A FUND EXCLUSIVELY OUT OF THE ASSETS OF THE RELEVANT FUND. AMONG INVESTORS, THE LIABILITIES OF EACH FUND SHALL ONLY BE INCURRED TO THE RESPECTIVE FUND. FOR PURPOSES OF ITEM 7.B., ONLY FUNDS WITH U.S. INVESTORS HAVE BEEN LISTED. COMGEST S.A., AS LISTED IN ITEM 7.A, IS RELYING ON UNIBANCO LETTERS AND THE FOREIGN PRIVATE ADVISER EXEMPTION.  IT PROVIDES ADVICE TO THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER AND DOES NOT PROVIDE ADVICE TO THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER'S CLIENTS.  THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER DOES NOT HAVE A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE UNITED STATES AND DOES NOT DIRECTLY ADVISE ANY U.S. CLIENTS.  THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER'S AUM ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE U.S. IS ONLY WITH RESPECT TO INVESTORS IN THE NON-U.S. CLIENT FUNDS IT ADVISES.  UNDER THESE CIRCUMSTANCES, THE CORRECT RESPONSE TO SCHEDULE D, ITEM 2.B. SHOULD BE $0, BUT DUE TO THE PROGRAMMING OF THIS FORM, WE WERE NOT ABLE TO ENTER $0 AS A RESPONSE.

WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGE HELD BY OUR AFFILIATE IN EACH SUCH FUND USING THE PAR VALUE OF THE NOTES HELD BY IT DIVIDED BY THE TOTAL PAR VALUE OF THE OUTSTANDING NOTES ISSUED BY THE RELEVANT FUND. THIS IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION (IPEVC) GUIDELINES, WHICH IS THE BASIS PRESCRIBED BY THE FUND DOCUMENTS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGES HELD BY THE VARIOUS CLASSES OF OWNER IN SUCH FUNDS BY REFERENCE TO THEIR ORIGINAL COMMITMENTS. ACTIS LLP IS ORGANIZED AS A LIMITED LIABILITY PARTNERHSIP IN THE UK.  THERE IS NO CONCEPT OF A GENERAL PARTNER WITH UNLIMITED LIABILITY IN A UK LLP. SECTION 7.B.(1):  WITH REGARD TO THE RESPONSE TO QUESTION 23 FOR THE SOMERS FUND LTD. ("SOMERS FUND"), PLEASE NOTE THAT SOMERS FUND, PURSUANT TO SECTION 88 OF THE COMPANIES ACT 1981 OF BERMUDA, AS AMENDED, DETERMINED NOT TO HAVE AN ANNUAL AUDIT.  QUESTION 23(G) ASKS WHETHER "THE PRIVATE FUND'S AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS [ARE] DISTRIBUTED TO THE PRIVATE FUND'S INVESTORS," AND QUESTION 23(H) ASKS WHETHER THE "REPORT PREPARED BY THE AUDITING FIRM CONTAIN[S] AN UNQUALIFIED OPINION"; THESE QUESTIONS INDICATE A RESPONSE IS REQUIRED.  THE RESPONSE TO 23(G) PROVIDED IN RESPECT OF SOMERS FUND IS "NO" AND TO 23(H) IS "NOT YET RECEIVED."  HOWEVER, IT IS THOUGHT THAT THE PHRASING OF QUESTIONS 23(G) AND (H) DOES NOT ALLOW A FULLY ACCURATE RESPONSE TO BE PROVIDED:  SOMERS FUND'S UNAUDITED STATEMENTS ARE DISTRIBUTED, BUT IT DOES NOT HAVE AUDITED STATEMENTS TO DISTRIBUTE, AND SIMILARLY, SOMERS FUND'S STATEMENTS, WHICH HAVE NOT BEEN AUDITED, HAVE THEREFORE NOT RECEIVED AN UNQUALIFIED OR QUALIFIED OPINION FROM AN AUDITOR.

PRANA REAL ESTATE FINANCE LLC ("PREF") MANAGES CITY FINANCE COMPANY LLC ("CFC"), WHICH HAS BEEN ORGANIZED TO PROVIDE FINANCING IN THE FORM OF LOANS TO ENTITIES CONTROLLED BY RELATED PERSONS OF PREF, AND IT MAY MANAGE SIMILAR ENTITIES IN THE FUTURE. SCHEDULE B:  PRANA HOLDING COMPANY, LLC HAS SEVERAL CLASSES OF MEMBERSHIP INTEREST THAT HAVE DIFFERENT INTERESTS IN PROFIT AND LOSS ALLOCATIONS AND DIFFERENT RIGHTS TO DISTRIBUTIONS ON DISSOLUTION.  AS A RESULT, ITS MEMBERS' RIGHTS TO RECEIVE DISTRIBUTIONS ON DISSOLUTION VARY FROM TIME TO TIME.  AT ANY GIVEN TIME, THE PROFITS INTEREST OF A MEMBER MAY EXCEED 25% OF A REVENUE SOURCE, BUT REGISTRANT BELIEVES THAT SUCH A PROFITS INTEREST IS NOT A 25% OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN PRANA HOLDING COMPANY, LLC AS SET FORTH IN THE INSTRUCTIONS TO THIS SCHEDULE.  THIS DISCLOSURE IS BEING PROVIDED, HOWEVER, TO EXPLAIN THAT CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS THAT MAY OR MAY NOT BE LISTED ON THIS SCHEDULE MAY HAVE A SIGNIFICANT PROFITS INTEREST IN PRANA HOLDING COMPANY, LLC.

THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER IS THE INVESTMENT MANAGER OF COMGEST GROWTH PLC, AN OPEN-ENDED INVESTMENT COMPANY WITH VARIABLE CAPITAL ORGANISED UNDER THE LAWS OF IRELAND WHICH QUALIFIES AND IS AUTHORISED IN IRELAND BY THE CENTRAL BANK OF IRELAND AS A UCITS FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE UCITS REGULATIONS. COMGEST GROWTH PLC IS STRUCTURED AS AN UMBRELLA FUND WITH SEGREGATED LIABILITY BETWEEN FUNDS IN THAT THE SHARE CAPITAL OF THE COMPANY MAY BE DIVIDED INTO DIFFERENT CLASSES OF SHARES WITH ONE OR MORE CLASSES REPRESENTING A SEPARATE FUND OF THE COMPANY.  EACH FUND IS A SEGREGATED PORTFOLIO OF ASSETS AND WILL ACCORDINGLY BEAR ITS OWN LIABILITIES. WITH REGARD TO THIRD PARTIES, IN PARTICULAR THE COMPANY'S CREDITORS, THE COMPANY SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL LIABILITIES INCURRED BY A FUND EXCLUSIVELY OUT OF THE ASSETS OF THE RELEVANT FUND. AMONG INVESTORS, THE LIABILITIES OF EACH FUND SHALL ONLY BE INCURRED TO THE RESPECTIVE FUND. FOR PURPOSES OF ITEM 7.B., ONLY FUNDS WITH U.S. INVESTORS HAVE BEEN LISTED. COMGEST S.A., AS LISTED IN ITEM 7.A, IS RELYING ON UNIBANCO LETTERS AND THE FOREIGN PRIVATE ADVISER EXEMPTION.  IT PROVIDES ADVICE TO THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER AND DOES NOT PROVIDE ADVICE TO THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER'S CLIENTS.  THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER DOES NOT HAVE A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE UNITED STATES AND DOES NOT DIRECTLY ADVISE ANY U.S. CLIENTS.  THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER'S AUM ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE U.S. IS ONLY WITH RESPECT TO INVESTORS IN THE NON-U.S. CLIENT FUNDS IT ADVISES.  UNDER THESE CIRCUMSTANCES, THE CORRECT RESPONSE TO SCHEDULE D, ITEM 2.B. SHOULD BE $0, BUT DUE TO THE PROGRAMMING OF THIS FORM, WE WERE NOT ABLE TO ENTER $0 AS A RESPONSE.

COMGEST GROWTH PLC IS STRUCTURED AS AN UMBRELLA FUND WITH SEGREGATED LIABILITY BETWEEN FUNDS IN THAT THE SHARE CAPITAL OF THE COMPANY MAY BE DIVIDED INTO DIFFERENT CLASSES OF SHARES WITH ONE OR MORE CLASSES REPRESENTING A SEPARATE FUND OF THE COMPANY. THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISERS DO NOT HAVE A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE UNITED STATES AND DO NOT DIRECTLY ADVISE ANY U.S. CLIENTS. FOOTNOTE TO FORM ADV, ITEM 1.A AND ITEM 3.A: NATIONAL VENTURE DEVELOPMENT (NVD) IS A BUSINESS UNIT OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC- SERIES A ("PF-A").  NVD FUNCTIONS AS AN OPERATING COMPANY TO PROVIDE INVESTMENT ADVICE TO THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC - SERIES C THROUGH SERIES J, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS, AND KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC - SERIES A & B.  INDIVIDUALS WORKING WITHIN NVD ARE EMPLOYEES OF PF-A AND THE EMPLOYMENT RELATED COSTS OF SUCH INDIVIDUALS ARE SHARED BY PF-A AND KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS.  NVD WAS CREATED TO GIVE ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE TO ACTIVITIES THAT ARE UNRELATED TO THE MEDICAL CARE PROVIDED BY THE MEMBERS OF PF-A AND KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS AND ITS AFFILIATES. THE SERIES A MEMBERS OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC, WHICH IS A DELAWARE SERIES LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY, ARE PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL CORPORATIONS AND A PARTNERSHIP LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES THAT PROVIDE MEDICAL AND RELATED SERVICES TO KAISER PERMANENTE MEMBERS AND PATIENTS.  SERIES A WAS FORMED IN 2002, AND IS THE SERIES UNDER WHICH ADMINISTRATIVE AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO ITS MEMBERS. AS NOTED ABOVE, INDIVIDUALS WORKING IN NVD ARE EMPLOYEES OF PF-A.  STARTING IN 2000, SEPARATE SERIES (SERIES C - J) (THE "PF INVESTMENT SERIES") HAVE BEEN CREATED TO PROVIDE POOLED INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE ENTITY MEMBERS OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC TO INVEST IN COMPANIES THAT PROVIDE INNOVATIVE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES IN THE HEALTH CARE INDUSTRY. STARTING IN 2000, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS HAS ALSO MADE INVESTMENTS IN HEALTH CARE RELATED COMPANIES, TYPICALLY INVESTING IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.   IN 2009, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS CREATED A FUND, KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES, LLC - SERIES A, WHICH IS A SERIES LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY UNDER DELAWARE LAW, AND THROUGH WHICH IT MAKES INVESTMENTS IN HEALTH CARE RELATED COMPANIES, AGAIN TYPICALLY IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.  IN 2010, KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC - SERIES B WAS FORMED TO FACILITATE THE INVESTMENT BY ENTITIES OTHER THAN KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS AND THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.  KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES - SERIES A AND SERIES B INVEST IN TANDEM, AND, AS NOTED ABOVE, TYPICALLY INVEST IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES. THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC AND KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC EACH HAVE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEES, IN THE CASE OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC WHOSE MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE MEMBERS OF SERIES A, AND IN THE CASE OF KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC WHOSE MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS.  THESE COMMITTEES ACT UPON INVESTMENT RECOMMENDATIONS OF NVD STAFF.

AS DISCLOSED IN SCHEDULE D, SECTION 7.B.(2) OF THIS FORM, ROCKMORE CAPITAL, LLC ("ROCKMORE") ACTS AS SUBADVISOR TO HEDGECO HYBRID MASTER FUND L.P. (THE "HEDGECO FUND"). THE PRINCIPAL INVESTMENT ADVISER TO THE HEDGECO FUND, HEDGECO HYBRID MASTER GP, LLC (THE "HEDGECO INVESTMENT ADVISER") HAS, THROUGH COUNSEL, INFORMED ROCKMORE THAT THE HEDGECO INVESTMENT ADVISER DOES NOT INTEND TO FILE A FORM ADV DUE TO THE HEDGECO INVESTMENT ADVISER HAVING FEWER THAN $25 MILLION REGULATORY ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT.  (Update, February 8, 2013) Rockmore is filing this other-than-annual amendment in response to direction by the Commission that Rockmore report the HedgeCo Fund on Section 7.B.(1) of Schedule D. As disclosed in the initial filing, Rockmore acted solely as a subadvisor to the HedgeCo Fund. (Rockmore ended its subadvisory relationship with the HedgeCo Fund in May, 2012.) As a subadvisor, Rockmore lacked the capability to respond to most of the items in Section 7.B.(1). In a letter dated February 4, 2013 (the HedgeCo Letter) and updated on February 7, 2013 (the "Updated Letter"), the HedgeCo Investment Adviser provided Rockmore with responses to items 1  28 of Section 7.B.(1). Except for items 17, 19, 20, 26(d), and 28(b), which request information specifically from Rockmore, the responses provided are those provided by the HedgeCo Investment Adviser in the HedgeCo Letter and the Updated Letter.  In responding to the items of Section 7.B.(1) for the HedgeCo Fund, Rockmore is relying on the representations made by the HedgeCo Investment Adviser in the HedgeCo Letter and the Updated Letter. In the Updated Letter, the HedgeCo Investment Adviser represented to Rockmore that the responses therein "contain no untrue statement of material fact, nor omit to state a material fact necessary in order to make the statement made, in light of the circumstances under which it is made, not misleading." Such representation does not extend to items 6(b) and 7 of Section 7.B.(1), responses to which the HedgeCo Investment Adviser withdrew from the Updated Letter.   Rockmore is not able to provide independent verification of the representations made by the HedgeCo Investment Adviser in the HedgeCo Letter and the Updated Letter.   Accordingly, Rockmore makes no claims regarding the material accuracy or completeness of the responses provided in the HedgeCo Letter, the Updated Letter, or, as a result, on Section 7.B.(1) (and in particular, items 6(b) and 7 thereof) for the HedgeCo Fund.  The HedgeCo Investment Adviser has declined to disclose the identity of other subadvisors to the HedgeCo Fund, as is requested by item 18(b) of Section 7.(B).(1). Therefore, Rockmore is unable to submit a response to that item.  As a result of reporting the HedgeCo Fund on Section 7.B.(1), Rockmore has removed its reporting of the HedgeCo Fund on Section 7.B.(2).

CAMBRIDGE PLACE INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT LLP (CPIM) IS ORGANIZED AS A LIMITED LIABILITY PARTNERSHIP IN THE UK.  THERE IS NO CONCEPT OF A GENERAL PARTNER WITH UNLIMITED LIABILITY IN A UK LLP.  INSTEAD, THE UK LLP FORM ALLOWS ALL "LIMITED PARTNERS" TO TAKE ACTIVE INVOLVEMENT IN THE BUSINESS WITH THE PROTECTION OF LIMITED LIABILITY AND THERE ARE "DESIGNATED MEMBERS" WHO ASSUME CERTAIN ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES.  THE PRIVATE FUNDS CAMBER 3 PLC, CAMBER 4 PLC AND STANTON MBS PLC LISTED ON SCHEDULE D ITEM 7B ARE CDOS FOR WHICH CPIM IS THE COLLATERAL MANAGER.   CPIM IS NOT THE ISSUER OF THESE CDOS AND DOES NOT HAVE ACCESS TO CURRENT INFORMATION REGARDING BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP.  INFORMATION REPORTED REGARDING THE BENEFICIAL OWNERS FOR CAMBER 3 IS CORRECT AS OF THE DATE OF INITIAL DISTRIBUTION.  INFORMATION REPORTED REGARDING THE BENEFICIAL OWNERS FOR CAMBER 4 AND STANTON IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE BELIEF THAT THE NUMBER OF BENEFICIAL HOLDERS IS LIKELY TO BE AROUND 25.  ONGOING INFORMATION RELATING TO THE BENEFICIAL OWNERS OF THE CDOS IS MAINTAINED BY THE TRUSTEE AND REGISTRAR FOR EACH CDO.  PLEASE NOTE THAT THESE CDOS ARE NO LONGER BEING MARKETED.

FOOTNOTE TO FORM ADV, ITEM 1.A AND ITEM 3.A: NATIONAL VENTURE DEVELOPMENT (NVD) IS A BUSINESS UNIT OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC- SERIES A ("PF-A").  NVD FUNCTIONS AS AN OPERATING COMPANY TO PROVIDE INVESTMENT ADVICE TO THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC - SERIES C THROUGH SERIES J, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS, AND KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC - SERIES A & B.  INDIVIDUALS WORKING WITHIN NVD ARE EMPLOYEES OF PF-A AND THE EMPLOYMENT RELATED COSTS OF SUCH INDIVIDUALS ARE SHARED BY PF-A AND KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS.  NVD WAS CREATED TO GIVE ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE TO ACTIVITIES THAT ARE UNRELATED TO THE MEDICAL CARE PROVIDED BY THE MEMBERS OF PF-A AND KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS AND ITS AFFILIATES. THE SERIES A MEMBERS OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC, WHICH IS A DELAWARE SERIES LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY, ARE PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL CORPORATIONS AND A PARTNERSHIP LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES THAT PROVIDE MEDICAL AND RELATED SERVICES TO KAISER PERMANENTE MEMBERS AND PATIENTS.  SERIES A WAS FORMED IN 2002, AND IS THE SERIES UNDER WHICH ADMINISTRATIVE AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO ITS MEMBERS. AS NOTED ABOVE, INDIVIDUALS WORKING IN NVD ARE EMPLOYEES OF PF-A.  STARTING IN 2000, SEPARATE SERIES (SERIES C - J) (THE "PF INVESTMENT SERIES") HAVE BEEN CREATED TO PROVIDE POOLED INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE ENTITY MEMBERS OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC TO INVEST IN COMPANIES THAT PROVIDE INNOVATIVE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES IN THE HEALTH CARE INDUSTRY. STARTING IN 2000, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS HAS ALSO MADE INVESTMENTS IN HEALTH CARE RELATED COMPANIES, TYPICALLY INVESTING IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.   IN 2009, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS CREATED A FUND, KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES, LLC - SERIES A, WHICH IS A SERIES LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY UNDER DELAWARE LAW, AND THROUGH WHICH IT MAKES INVESTMENTS IN HEALTH CARE RELATED COMPANIES, AGAIN TYPICALLY IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.  IN 2010, KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC - SERIES B WAS FORMED TO FACILITATE THE INVESTMENT BY ENTITIES OTHER THAN KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS AND THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.  KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES - SERIES A AND SERIES B INVEST IN TANDEM, AND, AS NOTED ABOVE, TYPICALLY INVEST IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES. THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC AND KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC EACH HAVE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEES, IN THE CASE OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC WHOSE MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE MEMBERS OF SERIES A, AND IN THE CASE OF KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC WHOSE MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS.  THESE COMMITTEES ACT UPON INVESTMENT RECOMMENDATIONS OF NVD STAFF.

SUBSTANTIALLY ALL OF DLJ CAPITAL CORP.'S RELATED PERSONS DO NOT MEET THE REQUIREMENTS TO BE DISCLOSED IN SECTION 7A OF SCHEDULE D BECAUSE: (1) CS BERMUDA HAS NO BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH THE RELATED PERSON IN CONNECTION WITH ADVISORY SERVICES PROVIDED TO ITS CLIENTS; (2) DLJ CAPITAL CORP. DOES NOT CONDUCT SHARED OPERATIONS WITH THE RELATED PERSON; (3) DLJ CAPITAL CORP. DOES NOT REFER CLIENTS OR BUSINESS TO THE RELATED PERSON, AND THE RELATED PERSON DOES NOT REFER PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS OR BUSINESS TO DLJ CAPITAL CORP.; (4) DLJ CAPITAL CORP. DO NOT SHARE SUPERVISED PERSONS OR PREMISES WITH THE RELATED PERSON; AND (5) DLJ CAPITAL CORP. DOES NOT CONTROL ANY OF ITS RELATED PERSONS AND NONE OF ITS RELATED PERSONS ACT AS A QUALIFIED CUSTODIAN FOR ANY OF DLJ CAPITAL CORP.'S CLIENTS IN CONNECTION WITH DLJ CAPITAL CORP.'S ADVISORY BUSINESS.  DLJ CAPITAL CORP.'S RELATED PARTIES THAT MAY BE REQUIRED TO BE DISCLOSED IN SECTION 7.A OF SCHEDULE D ARE PRIMARILY GENERAL PARTNERS, MANAGING MEMBERS OR SIMILARLY SITUATED PERSONS TO LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS, LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES OR OTHER ENTITIES FOR WHICH DLJ CAPITAL CORP. SERVES AS INVESTMENT ADVISER.  CERTAIN OF THOSE RELATED PERSONS MAY SHARE THE SAME PHYSICAL LOCATION WITH DLJ CAPITAL CORP. AND MAY SHARE SUPERVISED PERSONS WITH DLJ CAPITAL CORP. AS WELL. FURTHER INFORMATION ABOUT THOSE RELATED PARTIES, INCLUDING ANY SUPERVISED PERSONS SHARED WITH DLJ CAPITAL CORP., CAN BE FURNISHED UPON REQUEST. PARTNERS GROUP AG, ACTING AS THE LEAD FILER, IS COMPLETING THIS FORM ADV AS AN EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER (ERA) ON BEHALF OF EACH ENTITY LOCATED IN GUERNSEY AS DISCLOSED IN ITEM 7A (EACH A "RELYING ERA"). PARTNERS GROUP AG TOGETHER WITH EACH RELYING ERA ARE COMPLETING A SINGLE FORM ADV BASED UPON AN INTERPRETATION OF THE SEC STAFF'S POSITION EXPRESSED IN THE 2012 ABA NO ACTION LETTER.   WITH RESPECT TO THE PRIVATE FUNDS LISTED IN ITEM 7(B) THAT ARE SPECIFICALLY IDENTIFIED AS BEING ORGANIZED UNDER THE LAWS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM, PLEASE NOTE THAT THESE ARE SCOTTISH LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS GOVERNED BY SCOTTISH LAW; AS THE FORM DOES NOT PERMIT SCOTLAND TO BE LISTED AS A JURISDICTION, UNITED KINGDOM IS CHOSEN INSTEAD.  WITH RESPECT TO ITEM 11, THE FILING ERA AND EACH RELYING ERA HAS DISCUSSED INTERNALLY AND CONSULTED THE INFORMATION AVAILABLE, AND WITHOUT FURTHER INQUIRY AND TO THE BEST KNOWLEDGE OF THE FILING ERA AND EACH RELYING ERA, HAS PROVIDED THE RESPONSES CONTAINED IN ITEM 11.  WITH RESPECT TO RESPONSE FOR QUESTION 27 UNDER ITEM 7B (1) BEING O%, THIS MARKS A CHANGE FROM THE RESPONSE ON FORM ADV IN 2012 OF 100%. IN A 2013 REVIEW IT WAS DETERMINED THAT IT IS MORE APPROPRIATE TO RESPOND TO QUESTION 27 WITH A DISCLOSURE OF 0% AS EACH RELYING ERA MAY DETERMINE VALUATIONS OR ADJUST VALUATIONS PROVIDED BY EXTERNAL SOURCES. SPECIFICALLY, PARTNERS GROUP PERFORMS INDEPENDENT VALUATIONS OF ITS UNDERLYING INVESTMENTS THROUGH A FAIR MARKET VALUATION PROCESS, WHICH IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL REPORTING STANDARDS (IFRS) AND UNITED STATES GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES (US GAAP).  THIS PROCESS WAS IMPLEMENTED IN 2003 AND HAS BEEN HAS BEEN REFINED BASED ON FEEDBACK RECEIVED FROM PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS (PWC), THE AUDITOR OF THE PRIVATE FUNDS IDENTIFIED IN SECTION 7B (1).  ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, THE MONITORING AND VALUATION PROCESS BASED ON FAIR VALUATION PRINCIPLES (SAMPLE SELECTION, VALUATION METHODOLOGIES, ETC.) IS DISCUSSED AND APPROVED BY THE AUDITORS OF SUCH PRIVATE FUNDS MANAGED BY PARTNERS GROUP. PARTNERS GROUP COMPLIES WITH THE DEFINED PROCESS AND APPLIES IT AS THE BASIS FOR THE YEAR-END VALUATION AND SUBSEQUENT QUARTERLY NAV DETERMINATIONS OF THE PRIVATE FUNDS MANAGED BY THE FIRM.  THE PURPOSE OF PARTNERS GROUP'S INDEPENDENT VALUATION PROCESS IS TO DETERMINE THE FAIR VALUE OF AN INVESTMENT.  PURSUANT TO INTERNATIONAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS, FAIR VALUE IS DEFINED AS "THE AMOUNT FOR WHICH AN ASSET COULD BE EXCHANGED, OR A LIABILITY SETTLED, BETWEEN KNOWLEDGEABLE, WILLING PARTIES IN AN ARMS LENGTH TRANSACTION". THE NEED FOR SUCH PROCESS ARISES BECAUSE PRIVATE MARKETS PARTNERSHIPS MAY FOLLOW DIFFERENT ACCOUNTING STANDARDS AND/OR VALUATION GUIDELINES (E.G. IFRS, US GAAP, UK GAAP, INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION GUIDELINES (IPEV), AND OTHERS).  AS A RESULT, THE NAVS REPORTED BY AN INVESTMENT PARTNER ASSOCIATED WITH AN INVESTMENT MADE BY A PRIVATE FUND MAY NOT NECESSARILY REPRESENT THE "FAIR VALUE."   FURTHERMORE, THERE IS OFTEN A TIME LAG BETWEEN THE REPORTING DATE AND THE LATEST AVAILABLE INVESTMENT PARTNER REPORT.  PARTNERS GROUP'S INDEPENDENT VALUATION REVIEW THUS AIMS TO VERIFY AND IF NECESSARY, ADJUST THE UNDERLYING REPORTED NAVS AS STATED IN AN INVESTMENT PARTNER REPORT.  PARTNERS GROUP GATHERS THE VALUATION-RELEVANT INFORMATION BY SYSTEMATICALLY SCREENING A BROAD SET OF SOURCES FOR VALUATION-RELEVANT INFORMATION ABOUT PORTFOLIO COMPANIES WHICH ARE HELD DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY BY PARTNERS GROUP'S PRIVATE FUNDS. THIS INCLUDES INFORMATION SUPPLIED BY THE FIRM'S DUE DILIGENCE AND MONITORING PROFESSIONALS, UNDERLYING FUND MANAGERS AND INFORMATION PUBLISHED IN INDUSTRY JOURNALS AND/OR OTHER PUBLICATIONS.

ITEM 5. E/F/G APPLICANT PROVIDES INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT SERVICES TO A NUMBER OF CLIENTS WHICH ARE ORGANIZED AS PRIVATE INVESTMENT PARTNERSHIPS (THE "PARTNERSHIPS") EXEMPT FROM REGISTRATION UNDER THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT OF 1940 PURSUANT TO EITHER SECTION 3(C)(1) OR SECTION 3(C)(7).  THE APPLICANT RECEIVES MANAGEMENT FEES FROM THE PARTNERSHIPS GENERALLY RANGING FROM 1.0% TO 2.5% PER ANNUM BASED ON EACH PARTNERSHIPS'S COMMITTED CAPITAL OR ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT.  MANAGEMENT FEES ARE PAYABLE IN ADVANCE ON A QUARTERLY BASIS.  IN ADDITION, THE APPLICANT IS AFFILIATED WITH EACH OF THE ENTITIES ACTING AS GENERAL PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS.  THE GENERAL PARTNER ENTITIES RECEIVE AS A PERFORMANCE FEE ALLOCATION A PORTION OF THE NET GAINS OF SUCH PARTNERSHIPS RANGING FROM 10% TO 25% OF SUCH GAINS.  SUCH PERFORMANCE FEE ALLOCATIONS ARE GENERALLY DISTRIBUTED TO THE GENERAL PARTNER OF A PARTNERSHIP AT THE SAME TIME SUCH DISTRIBUTIONS ARE MADE TO THE LIMITED PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS.  THE SPECIFIC TERMS OF SUCH PERFORMANCE ALLOCATIONS COMPLY WITH RULE 205-3 OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT AND EACH OF THE LIMITED PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS IS A "QUALIFIED CLIENT."

ITEM 1.K. THE REGISTRANT HAS ENTERED INTO AN AGREEMENT WITH IRON MOUNTAIN INFORMATION MANAGEMENT, INC. ("IRON MOUNTAIN"), WITH RESPECT TO THE OFF-SITE MAINTENANCE OF CERTAIN OF ITS BOOKS AND RECORDS. IRON MOUNTAIN HAS FACILITIES THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES THAT ARE USED TO SAFEGUARD ITS CLIENT'S RECORDS. IRON MOUNTAIN MAY ACQUIRE AND DISPOSE OF FACILITIES WITHOUT GIVING NOTICE TO THE REGISTRANT AND AS SUCH, MAY MOVE THE REGISTRANT'S BOOKS AND RECORDS. DUE TO IRON MOUNTAIN'S ABILITY TO CHANGE, ACQUIRE OR DISPOSE OF ITS STORAGE FACILITIES, THE REGISTRANT IS UNABLE TO PROVIDE A LIST OF ALL FACILITIES AT WHICH ITS BOOKS AND RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED. SUBSEQUENT TO ITS ACQUISITION BY LBHI IN OCTOBER 2003, CERTAIN OF THE REGISTRANT'S BOOKS AND RECORDS BECAME THE PROPERTY OF LBHI; THESE BOOKS AND RECORDS WERE ALSO MAINTAINED BY IRON MOUNTAIN PURSUANT TO AN AGREEMENT WITH LBHI. SUBSEQUENT TO LBHI'S FILING FOR PROTECTION UNDER CHAPTER 11 OF THE U.S. BANKRUPTCY CODE, BARCLAYS BANK PLC ("BARCLAYS") ACQUIRED A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF ASSETS FROM LBHI. IN CONJUNCTION WITH SUCH ACQUISITION, BARCLAYS ACQUIRED CERTAIN OF LBHI'S BOOKS AND RECORDS, WHICH BARCLAYS MAINTAINS THROUGH ITS OWN AGREEMENT WITH IRON MOUNTAIN AND WHICH INCLUDES BOOKS AND RECORDS RELATING TO THE REGISTRANT. TO THE EXTENT THE REGISTRANT REQUIRES ACCESS TO BOOKS AND RECORDS FOR PERIODS PRIOR TO SEPTEMBER 15, 2008, IT MUST MAKE REQUESTS FOR ACCESS THROUGH BARCLAYS. SECTION 7.A. OF SCHEDULE D:  AFFILIATED MANAGERS GROUP, INC. (AMG), A PUBLICLY TRADED ASSET MANAGEMENT COMPANY, HOLDS AN EQUITY INTEREST IN PANTHEON.  AMGS EQUITY INTEREST IN PANTHEON IS STRUCTURED SO THAT WE MAINTAIN OPERATIONAL AUTONOMY IN MANAGING OUR BUSINESS.  AMG DOES NOT HAVE ANY ROLE IN OUR DAY-TO-DAY MANAGEMENT.  AMG ALSO HOLDS EQUITY INTERESTS IN CERTAIN OTHER INVESTMENT ADVISERS (AMG AFFILIATES).  EACH OF THE AMG AFFILIATES, INCLUDING PANTHEON, OPERATES AUTONOMOUSLY AND INDEPENDENTLY OF AMG AND OF EACH OTHER.  EXCEPT AS DESCRIBED IN THIS FORM ADV, WE DO NOT HAVE ANY BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH THESE AMG AFFILIATES AND DO NOT CONDUCT JOINT OPERATIONS WITH THEM.  PANTHEON CARRIES OUT ITS INVESTMENT ADVISORY ACTIVITY, INCLUDING THE EXERCISE OF INVESTMENT DISCRETION AND VOTING RIGHTS INDEPENDENT OF AMG AFFILIATES.  THE AMG AFFILIATES DOES NOT FORMULATE ADVICE FOR PANTHEONS CLIENTS AND DO NOT, IN OUR VIEW, PRESENT ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH OUR CLIENTS.  CONSEQUENTLY, INDIVIDUAL INFORMATION ON EACH AMG AFFILIATE IS NOT LISTED IN SECTION 7.A. OF SCHEDULE D.  A LIST OF ALL AMG AFFILIATES IS AVAILABLE TO OUR CLIENTS UPON REQUEST.  WE ARE A PARTY TO A CLIENT SERVICE / MARKETING AGREEMENT WITH ONE OR MORE AMG AFFILIATES UNDER WHICH AMG AFFILIATES PROVIDE CLIENT SERVICE AND MARKETING ASSISTANCE TO US IN CERTAIN NON-US JURISDICTIONS.  WE REIMBURSE AMG AFFILIATES FOR CERTAIN EXPENSES RELATED TO SERVICES PROVIDED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT. SUCH AMG AFFILIATES ARE NOT FINANCIAL INDUSTRY AFFILIATES OF THE TYPES DESCRIBED UNDER ITEM 7.A.  PANTHEON VENTURES (HK) LLP ("PV HK LLP") IS A RELATED PERSON WHICH IS BASED IN HONG KONG.  WE WORK WITH PV HK LLP ON IDENTIFYING AND EVALUATING CERTAIN INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES UNDER AN INTRA-COMPANY SERVICES ARRANGEMENT WITH PV HK LLP.  PV HK LLP IS NOT A FINANCIAL INDUSTRY AFFILIATE OF THE TYPES DESCRIBED UNDER ITEM 7.A.  WE ALSO HAVE OTHER RELATED PERSONS THAT DO NOT ADVISE "PRIVATE FUNDS" AND THEREFORE ARE NOT LISTED IN SECTION 7.A. OF SCHEDULE D. WITH RESPECT TO DUCHESS I CDO SA, DUCHESS III CDO SA, DUCHESS IV CLO BV, DUCHESS V CLO BV, DUCHESS VI CLO BV, DUCHESS VII CLO BV, FUGU CLO BV, MALIN CLO BV AND ROCKALL CLO BV (THE "SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS"), THE PERCENTAGE OF INVESTORS AND NUMBER OF BENEFICIAL OWNERS IS UNKNOWN (OTHER THAN OWNERSHIP BY OUR AFFILIATE, WHICH WE HAVE NOTED AS ONE BENEFICIAL OWNER FOR THESE PURPOSES). FURTHERMORE, REGARDING SUCH FUNDS AND FOR PURPOSES OF THESE CALCULATIONS, WE HAVE AGGREGATED ALL TRANCHES OF INTERESTS ISSUED BY SUCH FUNDS. WITH RESPECT TO THE SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS AND FUGU CREDIT PLC, WE HAVE CALCULATED GROSS ASSETS ON THE BASIS OF THE BALANCE SHEETS OF SUCH FUNDS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGE HELD BY OUR AFFILIATE IN EACH SUCH FUND USING THE PAR VALUE OF THE NOTES HELD BY IT DIVIDED BY THE TOTAL PAR VALUE OF THE OUTSTANDING NOTES ISSUED BY THE RELEVANT FUND. WITH RESPECT TO ALMACK I MEZZANINE LP, ALMACK II UNLEVERAGED LP AND ALMACK MEZZANINE III LP (THE "MEZZANINE FUNDS"), WE HAVE CALCULATED THE FUNDS' RESPECTIVE GROSS ASSETS BY VALUING DEBT ASSETS AT PAR PLUS ACCRUED INTEREST LESS IMPAIRMENTS AND EQUITY INVESTMENTS USING A MULTIPLES METHODOLOGY ON THE BASIS THAT THEY ARE HELD AT FAIR VALUE. THIS IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION (IPEVC) GUIDELINES, WHICH IS THE BASIS PRESCRIBED BY THE FUND DOCUMENTS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGES HELD BY THE VARIOUS CLASSES OF OWNER IN SUCH FUNDS BY REFERENCE TO THEIR ORIGINAL COMMITMENTS. THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER BELIEVES THE RELYING ADVISERS DO NOT NEED TO MAKE SEPARATE FILINGS BECAUSE: (i) EACH RELYING ADVISER ONLY ACTS AS THE GENERAL PARTNER FOR PRIVATE FUNDS ADVISED BY THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER; (ii) THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER CONTROLS EACH RELYING ADVISER; (iii) THE INVESTMENT ADVISORY ACTIVITIES OF EACH RELYING ADVISER ARE SUBJECT TO THE ADVISERS ACT; AND (iv)THE RELYING ADVISERS HAVE NO EMPLOYEES OR OTHER PERSONS ACTING ON THEIR BEHALF OTHER THAN PERSONS THAT ARE SUBJECT TO THE SUPERVISION AND CONTROL OF THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER.

ALL RESPONSES IN THIS REPORT RELATE TO AND INCLUDE ALL INFORMATION CONCERNING APPLICANT AND SUCH ERA AFFILIATE. Schedule D, Section 7.B.(1), Question 28, Marketers, requires clarification.  The answer to 28(c), name of the marketer, should be: Boenning & Scattergood, Inc.  The answer to 28(b), SEC file number, should be 8-15543.  When this information is inputed into the electronic Form ADV, the system automatically changes the answers to 1914 Advisors and 801-68111.  This is because 1914 Advisors is the investment advisor affiliate of Boenning & Scattergood, Inc., a broker-dealer, and that they both have the same CRD number of 100.  The system recognizes that CRD number 100 belongs to 1914 Advisors and automatically changes the answers for the name of the marketer and the SEC file number.  FINRA IARD instructs that there is no way to override the electronic system when answering this question.  FINRA IARD further instructs to supplement the filing of the Form ARD with this explanation.

Actis GP LLP is organized as a limited liabilty partnership in the UK.  There is no concept of a general partner with unlimited liability in a UK LLP.  Instead, the UK LLP form allows all "limited partners" to take active involvement in the business with the protection of limited liability and there are "designated members" who can assume certain additional responsibilities.  In section 7A we disclose affiliates that are foreign private advisers under Section 203(b)(3) of the Advisers Act, having no US clients or investors and no operations in the US.  The General Partners for the Funds disclosed in Section 7A are entities formed for tax and regulatory purposes, have no employees and if deemed to be investment advisers would be exempt from registration under the terms of the 2005 ABA no-action letter applying to special purpose vehicles set up for tax and regulatory accomodation purposes.

LLC as its NAV Calculation Agent. Additionally, the consolidated audited financial statements  are distributed to the Parent Funds investors within 120 days.

INSTEAD, THE UK LLP FORM ALLOWS ALL "LIMITED PARTNERS" TO TAKE ACTIVE INVOLVEMENT IN THE BUSINESS WITH THE PROTECTION OF LIMITED LIABIITY AND THERE ARE "DESIGNATED MEMBERS" WHO CAN ASSUME CERTAIN ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES. IN SECTION 7A WE DISCLOSE AFFILIATES THAT ARE FOREIGN PRIVATE ADVISERS UNDER SECTION 203(B)(3) OF THE ADVISERS ACT, HAVING NO US CLIENTS OR INVESTORS, NO PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE US, AND NO ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT RELATED TO US INVESTORS OR CLIENTS. PARTNERS GROUP AG, ACTING AS THE LEAD FILER, IS COMPLETING THIS FORM ADV AS AN EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER (ERA) ON BEHALF OF EACH ENTITY LOCATED IN GUERNSEY AS DISCLOSED IN ITEM 7A (EACH A "RELYING ERA"). PARTNERS GROUP AG TOGETHER WITH EACH RELYING ERA ARE COMPLETING A SINGLE FORM ADV BASED UPON AN INTERPRETATION OF THE SEC STAFF'S POSITION EXPRESSED IN THE 2012 ABA NO ACTION LETTER.   WITH RESPECT TO THE PRIVATE FUNDS LISTED IN ITEM 7(B) THAT ARE SPECIFICALLY IDENTIFIED AS BEING ORGANIZED UNDER THE LAWS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM, PLEASE NOTE THAT THESE ARE SCOTTISH LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS GOVERNED BY SCOTTISH LAW; AS THE FORM DOES NOT PERMIT SCOTLAND TO BE LISTED AS A JURISDICTION, UNITED KINGDOM IS CHOSEN INSTEAD.  WITH RESPECT TO ITEM 11, THE FILING ERA AND EACH RELYING ERA HAS DISCUSSED INTERNALLY AND CONSULTED THE INFORMATION AVAILABLE, AND WITHOUT FURTHER INQUIRY AND TO THE BEST KNOWLEDGE OF THE FILING ERA AND EACH RELYING ERA, HAS PROVIDED THE RESPONSES CONTAINED IN ITEM 11.  WITH RESPECT TO RESPONSE FOR QUESTION 27 UNDER ITEM 7B (1) BEING O%, THIS MARKS A CHANGE FROM THE RESPONSE ON FORM ADV IN 2012 OF 100%. IN A 2013 REVIEW IT WAS DETERMINED THAT IT IS MORE APPROPRIATE TO RESPOND TO QUESTION 27 WITH A DISCLOSURE OF 0% AS EACH RELYING ERA MAY DETERMINE VALUATIONS OR ADJUST VALUATIONS PROVIDED BY EXTERNAL SOURCES. SPECIFICALLY, PARTNERS GROUP PERFORMS INDEPENDENT VALUATIONS OF ITS UNDERLYING INVESTMENTS THROUGH A FAIR MARKET VALUATION PROCESS, WHICH IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL REPORTING STANDARDS (IFRS) AND UNITED STATES GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES (US GAAP).  THIS PROCESS WAS IMPLEMENTED IN 2003 AND HAS BEEN HAS BEEN REFINED BASED ON FEEDBACK RECEIVED FROM PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS (PWC), THE AUDITOR OF THE PRIVATE FUNDS IDENTIFIED IN SECTION 7B (1).  ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, THE MONITORING AND VALUATION PROCESS BASED ON FAIR VALUATION PRINCIPLES (SAMPLE SELECTION, VALUATION METHODOLOGIES, ETC.) IS DISCUSSED AND APPROVED BY THE AUDITORS OF SUCH PRIVATE FUNDS MANAGED BY PARTNERS GROUP. PARTNERS GROUP COMPLIES WITH THE DEFINED PROCESS AND APPLIES IT AS THE BASIS FOR THE YEAR-END VALUATION AND SUBSEQUENT QUARTERLY NAV DETERMINATIONS OF THE PRIVATE FUNDS MANAGED BY THE FIRM.  THE PURPOSE OF PARTNERS GROUP'S INDEPENDENT VALUATION PROCESS IS TO DETERMINE THE FAIR VALUE OF AN INVESTMENT.  PURSUANT TO INTERNATIONAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS, FAIR VALUE IS DEFINED AS "THE AMOUNT FOR WHICH AN ASSET COULD BE EXCHANGED, OR A LIABILITY SETTLED, BETWEEN KNOWLEDGEABLE, WILLING PARTIES IN AN ARMS LENGTH TRANSACTION". THE NEED FOR SUCH PROCESS ARISES BECAUSE PRIVATE MARKETS PARTNERSHIPS MAY FOLLOW DIFFERENT ACCOUNTING STANDARDS AND/OR VALUATION GUIDELINES (E.G. IFRS, US GAAP, UK GAAP, INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION GUIDELINES (IPEV), AND OTHERS).  AS A RESULT, THE NAVS REPORTED BY AN INVESTMENT PARTNER ASSOCIATED WITH AN INVESTMENT MADE BY A PRIVATE FUND MAY NOT NECESSARILY REPRESENT THE "FAIR VALUE."   FURTHERMORE, THERE IS OFTEN A TIME LAG BETWEEN THE REPORTING DATE AND THE LATEST AVAILABLE INVESTMENT PARTNER REPORT.  PARTNERS GROUP'S INDEPENDENT VALUATION REVIEW THUS AIMS TO VERIFY AND IF NECESSARY, ADJUST THE UNDERLYING REPORTED NAVS AS STATED IN AN INVESTMENT PARTNER REPORT.  PARTNERS GROUP GATHERS THE VALUATION-RELEVANT INFORMATION BY SYSTEMATICALLY SCREENING A BROAD SET OF SOURCES FOR VALUATION-RELEVANT INFORMATION ABOUT PORTFOLIO COMPANIES WHICH ARE HELD DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY BY PARTNERS GROUP'S PRIVATE FUNDS. THIS INCLUDES INFORMATION SUPPLIED BY THE FIRM'S DUE DILIGENCE AND MONITORING PROFESSIONALS, UNDERLYING FUND MANAGERS AND INFORMATION PUBLISHED IN INDUSTRY JOURNALS AND/OR OTHER PUBLICATIONS.

*** Investments in the Adelis Equity Partners Fund I AB (Master Fund) are made by way of instruments called principal-linked participating loans under local Swedish law.  These instruments function in all material respects like limited partnerships in traditional private equity funds, and, accordingly, the information provided about the Master Fund in this ADV relates to the investors in the fund.  However, the legal owners of the Master Fund under Swedish law are the employee shareholders of the fund, and not the investors.  Investments in the Adelis Equity Partners Fund I Feeder SA fund (Feeder Fund) and the Adelis Friends & Family I AB fund (Friends & Family Fund) are made by way of traditional private equity instruments.  *** The financial statements of the Master Fund and the Friends & Family Fund are prepared in accordance with Swedish GAAP, and the financial statements of the Feeder Fund are prepared in accordance with Luxembourg GAAP.

SCHEDULES A AND B - IFS TRUSTEES (THE "COMPANY") IS A BUSINESS BASED IN MAURITIUS, WHICH PROVIDES PROFESSIONAL TRUSTEE SERVICES. THE COMPANY ACTS AS TRUSTEE FOR VARIOUS TRUST FUNDS. EACH TRUSTEE RELATIONSHIP COMPRISES A DISCRETE SET OF OBLIGATIONS IMPOSED BY THE RELEVANT TRUST INSTRUMENT. WHEN ACTING AS TRUSTEE THE COMPANY IS REQUIRED TO ACT IN DIFFERENT CAPACITIES TO REFLECT THE SEPARATE FIDUCIARY DUTY IT OWES TO THE BENEFICIARIES OF EACH TRUST. ACCORDINGLY ANY DECISIONS TAKEN BY THE COMPANY IN ITS CAPACITY AS TRUSTEE OF EACH TRUST FUND ARE DISTINCT FROM ONE ANOTHER AND STEM FROM SEPARATE DECISION MAKING PROCESSES.

THE PRIVATE FUNDS CAMBER 3 PLC, CAMBER 4 PLC AND STANTON MBS PLC LISTED ON SCHEDULE D ITEM 7B ARE CDOS FOR WHICH CPIM IS THE COLLATERAL MANAGER. INFORMATION REPORTED REGARDING THE BENEFICIAL OWNERS FOR CAMBER 4 AND STANTON IS ESTIMATED BASED ON THE BELIEF THAT THE NUMBER OF BENEFICIAL HOLDERS IS LIKELY TO BE AROUND 25. NONE OF THE PRIVATE FUNDS RECEIVED AN AUDIT IN 2013. HOWEVER, THESE FUNDS DID RECEIVE AN AUDIT IN THE PAST AND AT SUCH TIME RECEIVED AN UNQUALIFIED OPINION. SINCE THE PRIVATE FUNDS HAD RECEIVED AN AUDIT IN THE PAST, DUE TO A TECHNICAL GLITCH IN THE FORM ADV THE INVESTMENT ADVISER IS REQUIRED TO ANSWER QUESTION 23(h) EVEN TH0UGH THE PRIVATE FUNDS HAVE NOT RECEIVED AN AUDIT FOR 2013. AS A RESULT, THE INVESTMENT ADVISER HAS SELECTED "REPORT NOT YET RECEIVED" EVEN THOUGH CERTAIN OF THESE FUNDS WILL NOT RECEIVE ANY AUDIT REPORT FOR 2013.

*** Investments in the Adelis Equity Partners Fund I AB (Master Fund) are made by way of instruments called principal-linked participating loans under local Swedish law.  These instruments function in all material respects like limited partnerships in traditional private equity funds, and, accordingly, the information provided about the Master Fund in this ADV relates to the investors in the fund.  However, the legal owners of the Master Fund under Swedish law are the employee shareholders of the fund, and not the investors.  Investments in the Adelis Equity Partners Fund I Feeder SA fund (Feeder Fund) and the Adelis Friends & Family I AB fund (Friends & Family Fund) are made by way of traditional private equity instruments.  *** The financial statements of the Master Fund and the Friends & Family Fund are prepared in accordance with Swedish GAAP, and the financial statements of the Feeder Fund are prepared in accordance with Luxembourg GAAP.

ACTIS LLP IS ORGANIZED AS A LIMITED LIABILITY PARTNERHSIP IN THE UK.  THERE IS NO CONCEPT OF A GENERAL PARTNER WITH UNLIMITED LIABILITY IN A UK LLP.  INSTEAD, THE UK LLP FORM ALLOWS ALL "LIMITED PARTNERS" TO TAKE ACTIVE INVOLVEMENT IN THE BUSINESS WITH THE PROTECTION OF LIMITED LIABIITY AND THERE ARE "DESIGNATED MEMBERS" WHO CAN ASSUME CERTAIN ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES. IN SECTION 7A WE DISCLOSE AFFILIATES THAT ARE FOREIGN PRIVATE ADVISERS UNDER SECTION 203(B)(3) OF THE ADVISERS ACT, HAVING NO US CLIENTS OR INVESTORS, NO PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE US, AND NO ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT RELATED TO US INVESTORS OR CLIENTS.  THE GENERAL PARTNERS FOR THE FUNDS DISCLOSED IN SECTION 7A ARE ENTITIES FORMED FOR TAX AND REGULATORY PURPOSES, HAVE NO EMPLOYEES AND IF DEEMED TO BE INVESTMENT ADVISERS WOULD BE EXEMPT FROM REGISTRATION UNDER THE TERMS OF THE 2005 ABA NO-ACTION LETTER APPLYING TO SPECIAL PURPOSE VEHICELS SET UP FOR TAX AND REGULATORY ACCOMODATION PURPOSES. Actis GP LLP is organized as a limited liabilty partnership in the UK.  There is no concept of a general partner with unlimited liability in a UK LLP.  Instead, the UK LLP form allows all "limited partners" to take active involvement in the business with the protection of limited liability and there are "designated members" who can assume certain additional responsibilities.  In section 7A we disclose affiliates that are foreign private advisers under Section 203(b)(3) of the Advisers Act, having no US clients or investors and no operations in the US.  The General Partners for the Funds disclosed in Section 7A are entities formed for tax and regulatory purposes, have no employees and if deemed to be investment advisers would be exempt from registration under the terms of the 2005 ABA no-action letter applying to special purpose vehicles set up for tax and regulatory accomodation purposes.

THE ACTIVITIES SPECIFIED IN ITEM 7 (PART A1) AND SECTION 7.A (SCHEDULE D) OF THE FORM ADV DO NOT MATCH WITH THE CURRENT BUSINESS ACTIVITY OF THIS RELATED PERSON.  FURTHER TO THE TELEPHONE CONVERSATION THAT WE HAD WITH THE SEC OFFICE AND FURTHER TO THE EMAIL SEND FROM THE SEC DIVISION OF INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT DATED ON MARCH THE 1ST 2012, WE UNDERSTOOD THAT WE DO NOT HAVE TO COMPLETE THESE ITEM 7 (PART A1) AND SECTION 7.A (SCHEDULE D) GIVEN THAT ONLY THE SPECIFIED ACTIVITIES IN THESE ITEM AND SECTION ARE CONSIDERED AS POTENTIALLY GENERATING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST BETWEEN THE INVESTMENT ADVISER AND ITS CLIENTS WHICH ARE NOTABLY RELATED PERSONS.  PLEASE NOTE THAT THE RELEVANT RELATED PERSON WILL BE SPECIFIED AS DIRECT OWNER IN THE SCHEDULE A.  (II) WE QUALIFY FOR THE EXEMPTION FROM REGISTRATION BECAUSE WE ACT SOLELY AS AN ADVISER TO PRIVATE FUNDS AND HAVE ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT IN THE UNITED STATES OF LESS THAN $150 MILLION. ACCORDINGLY, WE MUST COMPLETE SECTION 2.B OF THE SCHEDULE D. GIVEN THAT OUR PRINCIPAL OFFICE AND PLACE OF BUSINESS IS OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED STATES AND NO ONE OF THE PRIVATE FUND ASSET THAT WE MANAGED IS MANAGED AT A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE UNITED STATES, THE AMOUNT TO INDICATE IN THIS SECTION IS ZERO.  (III)NUMBERS INDICATED IN UNITED STATES DOLLARS WERE CALCULATED IN TAKING INTO ACCOUNT THE CONVERSION'S RATE (EURO/USD) ON 02 JANUARY 2013.

Please see Item l.J. and Schedule A. Mr. Steenkamp, 37 years old, had served as the Chief Financial Officer of MF Global Holdings Ltd., a broker in commodities and derivatives, from April 2011. Prior to that, Mr. Steenkamp held the position of Chief Accounting Officer and Global Controller at MF Global for four years. He joined MF Global, then Man Financial, in 2006 as Vice President of External Reporting and Accounting Policy. After MF Global filed for bankruptcy protection in October 2011, he continued to serve as Chief Financial Officer through January 2013. Before joining MF Global, Mr. Steenkamp spent eight years with PricewaterhouseCoopers {"PwC"), including four years in Transaction Services in its New York office, managing a variety of capital-raising transactions on a global basis. His focus was also on the SEC registration and public company filing process, including technical accounting. He spent four years with PwC in South Africa, where he served as an auditor primarily for SEC registrants and assisted South African companies as they went public in the U.S. Mr. Steenkamp is a chartered accountant and holds an honors degree in Finance.

Schedule D, Section 6.B.(2) - Pareto Project Finance AS facilitates the establishment, and the debt and equity capitalization, of special purpose vehicles organized outside of the United States that acquire assets in the shipping, offshore services and real estate sectors.  Once capitalized, such special purpose vehicles are typically managed and controlled by third parties who are unaffiliated with Pareto Project Finance AS.  In addition to the foregoing, Pareto Project Finance AS also facilitates the establishment of, and provides investment advisory services to, sector-specific private investment funds which maintain a portfolio of investments, including potential investments in the special purpose vehicles mentioned above.

Three indirect owners of JMI Management, Inc. (JMI) serve as the three trustees (the Trustees) of each of ten Maryland statutory trusts (the Trusts).  The sole purpose of each of the Trusts is to hold and sell, distribute or otherwise dispose of the common stock of certain public companies held by the Trusts over such period as the Trustees determine to be in the best interest of the beneficial owners of the Trusts.  The securities that are held by the Trusts were distributed to the Trusts by private funds advised by JMI.  The Trustees have sole and exclusive investment discretion with respect to the Trusts.  JMI provides no investment advisory services to the Trusts, has no contractual relationship with the Trusts, and has no investment management or advisory arrangement with the Trusts.

WITH RESPECT TO DUCHESS I CDO SA, DUCHESS III CDO SA, DUCHESS IV CLO BV, DUCHESS V CLO BV, DUCHESS VI CLO BV, DUCHESS VII CLO BV, FUGU CLO BV, MALIN CLO BV AND ROCKALL CLO BV (THE "SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS"), THE PERCENTAGE OF INVESTORS AND NUMBER OF BENEFICIAL OWNERS IS UNKNOWN (OTHER THAN OWNERSHIP BY OUR AFFILIATE, WHICH WE HAVE NOTED AS ONE BENEFICIAL OWNER FOR THESE PURPOSES). FURTHERMORE, REGARDING SUCH FUNDS AND FOR PURPOSES OF THESE CALCULATIONS, WE HAVE AGGREGATED ALL TRANCHES OF INTERESTS ISSUED BY SUCH FUNDS. WITH RESPECT TO THE SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS WE HAVE CALCULATED GROSS ASSETS ON THE BASIS OF THE BALANCE SHEETS OF SUCH FUNDS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGE HELD BY OUR AFFILIATE IN EACH SUCH FUND USING THE PAR VALUE OF THE NOTES HELD BY IT DIVIDED BY THE TOTAL PAR VALUE OF THE OUTSTANDING NOTES ISSUED BY THE RELEVANT FUND. WITH RESPECT TO ALMACK I MEZZANINE LP, ALMACK II UNLEVERAGED LP AND ALMACK MEZZANINE III LP (THE "MEZZANINE FUNDS"), WE HAVE CALCULATED THE FUNDS' RESPECTIVE GROSS ASSETS BY VALUING DEBT ASSETS AT PAR PLUS ACCRUED INTEREST LESS IMPAIRMENTS AND EQUITY INVESTMENTS USING A MULTIPLES METHODOLOGY ON THE BASIS THAT THEY ARE HELD AT FAIR VALUE. THIS IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION (IPEVC) GUIDELINES, WHICH IS THE BASIS PRESCRIBED BY THE FUND DOCUMENTS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGES HELD BY THE VARIOUS CLASSES OF OWNER IN SUCH FUNDS BY REFERENCE TO THEIR ORIGINAL COMMITMENTS. WITH RESPECT TO DEUTSCHE BANK AG, LONDON BRANCH ("DEUTSCHE BANK") LISTED IN ITEM 7.B.1 OF SCHEDULE D AS CUSTODIAN FOR CERTAIN PRIVATE FUNDS WE ADVISE, WE MAY ALSO USE VARIOUS AFFILIATES OF DEUTSCHE BANK FOR CUSTODY

THE APPLICANT IS AN INDIRECT WHOLLY OWNED SUBSIDIARY OF THE ROYAL BANK OF SCOTLAND GROUP PLC ("RBS"), A PUBLICLY TRADED COMPANY IN THE UNITED KINGDOM.  THE DIRECT AND INDIRECT SUBSIDIARIES OF RBS ARE ENGAGED IN OPERATIONS THAT SPAN RETAIL BANKING, CORPORATE AND COMMERCIAL BANKING, FINANCIAL MARKETS ACTIVITIES, WEALTH MANAGEMENT, INSURANCE AND ASSET MANAGEMENT.  HOWEVER, THE APPLICANT CONDUCTS ITS OPERATIONS SEPARATELY FROM THE OTHER DIVISIONS AND UNITS OF RBS.  THE APPLICANT IS AFFILIATED WITH NUMEROUS ENTITIES THAT ENGAGE IN FINANCIAL SERVICES ACTIVITIES.  CERTAIN OF THESE ENTITIES MAY BE SUBJECT TO CERTAIN DISCIPLINARY EVENTS PURSUANT TO ITEM 11.  NO SUCH DISCIPLINARY EVENTS ARE IN CONNECTION WITH THE ACTIVITIES OR BUSINESS OF THE APPLICANT OR ITS SUPERVISED PERSONS.  THE APPLICANT IS REQUIRED BY FORM ADV TO ENTER AN AMOUNT OF AT LEAST US $1 IN SCHEDULE D, SECTION 2B; HOWEVER, AS THE APPLICANT DOES NOT HAVE A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE UNITED STATES, IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY PRIVATE ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT "IN THE UNITED STATES."  THE APPLICANT ADVISES INVESTMENT FUNDS THAT ARE PUBLICLY OFFERED OUTSIDE OF THE U.S. AND THAT ARE REGISTERED WITH VARIOUS FOREIGN FINANCIAL AUTHORITIES.  THESE FUNDS WERE NOT PUBLICLY OFFERED IN THE U.S. AND ANY U.S. INVESTORS WERE NOT RESIDENT IN THE U.S. AT THE TIME OF SALE.  ALL SUCH FUNDS COMPLY WITH 3(C)(1) OF THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT AND APPLICABLE SEC GUIDANCE.

ITEM 5. E/F/G APPLICANT PROVIDES INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT SERVICES TO A NUMBER OF CLIENTS WHICH ARE ORGANIZED AS PRIVATE INVESTMENT PARTNERSHIPS (THE "PARTNERSHIPS") EXEMPT FROM REGISTRATION UNDER THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT OF 1940 PURSUANT TO EITHER SECTION 3(C)(1) OR SECTION 3(C)(7).  THE APPLICANT RECEIVES MANAGEMENT FEES FROM THE PARTNERSHIPS GENERALLY RANGING FROM 1.0% TO 2.5% PER ANNUM BASED ON EACH PARTNERSHIPS'S COMMITTED CAPITAL OR ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT.  MANAGEMENT FEES ARE PAYABLE IN ADVANCE ON A QUARTERLY BASIS.  IN ADDITION, THE APPLICANT IS AFFILIATED WITH EACH OF THE ENTITIES ACTING AS GENERAL PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS.  THE GENERAL PARTNER ENTITIES RECEIVE AS A PERFORMANCE FEE ALLOCATION A PORTION OF THE NET GAINS OF SUCH PARTNERSHIPS RANGING FROM 10% TO 25% OF SUCH GAINS.  SUCH PERFORMANCE FEE ALLOCATIONS ARE GENERALLY DISTRIBUTED TO THE GENERAL PARTNER OF A PARTNERSHIP AT THE SAME TIME SUCH DISTRIBUTIONS ARE MADE TO THE LIMITED PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS.  THE SPECIFIC TERMS OF SUCH PERFORMANCE ALLOCATIONS COMPLY WITH RULE 205-3 OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT AND EACH OF THE LIMITED PARTNERS OF THE PARTNERSHIPS IS A "QUALIFIED CLIENT."

THESE ADMINISTRATORS ARE NOT RELATED PERSONS OF THE FIRM AND DO NOT SEND INVESTOR ACCOUNT STATEMENTS TO PRIVATE FUND INVESTORS.  TO AVOID ANY PERCEIVED DUPLICATION OF ASSETS, THE ASSETS OF ANY SPVS ORGANIZED IN CONNECTION WITH PRIVATE FUNDS ARE INCLUDED IN THE VALUE OF THE TOTAL ASSETS OF THE APPLICABLE PRIVATE FUND(S) TO WHICH SUCH SPVS RELATE AND THEREFORE THE SPVS ARE NOT LISTED SEPARATELY IN SCHEDULE D. LLC IS AFFILIATED WITH SEVERAL GENERAL PARTNER ENTITIES, WHICH ARE FULLY DISCLOSED IN SECTION 7.A OF SCHEDULE D, AND EACH GENERAL PARTNER ENTITY IS CONTROLLED BY CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS SET FORTH IN SECTION 10.A OF SCHEDULE D AND SCHEDULE A.

SECTION 7.A. OF SCHEDULE D:   AFFILIATED MANAGERS GROUP, INC. (AMG), A PUBLICLY TRADED ASSET MANAGEMENT COMPANY, HOLDS AN EQUITY INTEREST IN PANTHEON.  AMGS EQUITY INTEREST IN PANTHEON IS STRUCTURED SO THAT WE MAINTAIN OPERATIONAL AUTONOMY IN MANAGING OUR BUSINESS.  AMG DOES NOT HAVE ANY ROLE IN OUR DAY-TO-DAY MANAGEMENT.  AMG ALSO HOLDS EQUITY INTERESTS IN CERTAIN OTHER INVESTMENT ADVISERS (AMG AFFILIATES).  EACH OF THE AMG AFFILIATES, INCLUDING PANTHEON, OPERATES AUTONOMOUSLY AND INDEPENDENTLY OF AMG AND OF EACH OTHER.  EXCEPT AS DESCRIBED IN THIS FORM ADV, WE DO NOT HAVE ANY BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH THESE AMG AFFILIATES AND DO NOT CONDUCT JOINT OPERATIONS WITH THEM.  PANTHEON CARRIES OUT ITS INVESTMENT ADVISORY ACTIVITY, INCLUDING THE EXERCISE OF INVESTMENT DISCRETION AND VOTING RIGHTS INDEPENDENT OF AMG AFFILIATES.  THE AMG AFFILIATES DOES NOT FORMULATE ADVICE FOR PANTHEONS CLIENTS AND DO NOT, IN OUR VIEW, PRESENT ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH OUR CLIENTS.  CONSEQUENTLY, INDIVIDUAL INFORMATION ON EACH AMG AFFILIATE IS NOT LISTED IN SECTION 7.A. OF SCHEDULE D.  A LIST OF ALL AMG AFFILIATES IS AVAILABLE TO OUR CLIENTS UPON REQUEST.  WE ARE A PARTY TO A CLIENT SERVICE / MARKETING AGREEMENT WITH ONE OR MORE AMG AFFILIATES UNDER WHICH AMG AFFILIATES PROVIDE CLIENT SERVICE AND MARKETING ASSISTANCE TO US IN CERTAIN NON-US JURISDICTIONS.  WE REIMBURSE AMG AFFILIATES FOR CERTAIN EXPENSES RELATED TO SERVICES PROVIDED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT. SUCH AMG AFFILIATES ARE NOT FINANCIAL INDUSTRY AFFILIATES OF THE TYPES DESCRIBED UNDER ITEM 7.A. PV HK LLP IS NOT A FINANCIAL INDUSTRY AFFILIATE OF THE TYPES DESCRIBED UNDER ITEM 7.A. CERTAIN OF THE PRIVATE FUNDS DISCLOSED IN THIS FORM ADV (COLLECTIVELY, "CRV FUNDS") MAY UTILIZE ONE OR MORE ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENT VEHICLES AND/OR OTHER TYPES OF SPECIAL PURPOSE VEHICLES (COLLECTIVELY, "SPVS") FOR THE PURPOSE OF: (I) ADDRESSING TAX, REGULATORY AND/OR STRUCTURAL ISSUES AND (II) FACILITATING CERTAIN INVESTMENTS BY SUCH CRV FUNDS AND/OR CERTAIN INVESTORS IN SUCH CRV FUNDS.  TO AVOID ANY PERCEIVED DUPLICATION OF ASSETS, THE ASSETS OF ANY SPVS ARE INCLUDED IN THE VALUE OF TOTAL ASSETS OF THE APPLICABLE CRV FUNDS TO WHICH SUCH SPVS RELATE. ADDITIONALLY, THE INFORMATION PROVIDE IN SECTION 7.B. OF SCHEDULE D WITH RESPECT TO A CRV FUND IS, TO THE EXTENT RELEVANT, GENERALLY APPLICABLE WITH RESPECT TO ITS RELATED SPVS (IF ANY).  CONSEQUENTLY, THE SPVS HAVE NOT BEEN IDENTIFIED SEPARATELY IN SECTION 7.B. OF SCHEDULE D.

UPON SPEAKING TO IARD STAFF ABOUT THE PROBLEM, WE WERE INSTRUCTED TO CHECK ANY STATE (WE CHOSE "NEW YORK"), AND EXPLAIN THE IARD SYSTEM LIMITATIONS IN THIS SCHEDULE D MISCELLANEOUS SECTION.  FINALLY, IN SECTION 2.B OF SHCEDULE 7 WE WERE REQUIRED TO INSERT THE AMOUNT OF PRIVATE FUND ASSETS.  WE HAVE INSERTED $25000000.  HOWEVER NOTE 10 IN CONNECTION WITH THIS SECTION STATES THAT "IF YOU ARE AN INVESTMENT ADVISER WITH ITS PRINCIPAL OFFICE AND PLACE OF BUSINESS OUTSIDE OF THE US ONLY INCLUDE PRIVATE FUND ASSETS THAT YOU MANAGE AT A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE US".  WE HAVE NO PLACE OF BUSINESS AND AS SUCH HAD LEFT THE SECTION BLANK WHICH PREVENTED US FROM FILING.  THE $25000000 REPRESENTS THE AMOUNT OF COMMITMENT WE HAVE FROM ONE INVESTOR IN THE US.  AGAIN WE WOULD LIKE TO STRESS THAT WE HAVE NO PLACE OF BUSINESS OR CONNECTION OR PRESENCE IN THE US.

FOOTNOTE TO FORM ADV, ITEM 1.A AND ITEM 3.A: NATIONAL VENTURE DEVELOPMENT (NVD) IS A BUSINESS UNIT OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC- SERIES A ("PF-A").  NVD FUNCTIONS AS AN OPERATING COMPANY TO PROVIDE INVESTMENT ADVICE TO THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC - SERIES C THROUGH SERIES J, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS, AND KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC - SERIES A & B.  INDIVIDUALS WORKING WITHIN NVD ARE EMPLOYEES OF PF-A AND THE EMPLOYMENT RELATED COSTS OF SUCH INDIVIDUALS ARE SHARED BY PF-A AND KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS.  NVD WAS CREATED TO GIVE ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE TO ACTIVITIES THAT ARE UNRELATED TO THE MEDICAL CARE PROVIDED BY THE MEMBERS OF PF-A AND KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS AND ITS AFFILIATES. THE SERIES A MEMBERS OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC, WHICH IS A DELAWARE SERIES LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY, ARE PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL CORPORATIONS AND A PARTNERSHIP LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES THAT PROVIDE MEDICAL AND RELATED SERVICES TO KAISER PERMANENTE MEMBERS AND PATIENTS.  SERIES A WAS FORMED IN 2002, AND IS THE SERIES UNDER WHICH ADMINISTRATIVE AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO ITS MEMBERS. AS NOTED ABOVE, INDIVIDUALS WORKING IN NVD ARE EMPLOYEES OF PF-A.  STARTING IN 2000, SEPARATE SERIES (SERIES C - J) (THE "PF INVESTMENT SERIES") HAVE BEEN CREATED TO PROVIDE POOLED INVESTMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE ENTITY MEMBERS OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC TO INVEST IN COMPANIES THAT PROVIDE INNOVATIVE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES IN THE HEALTH CARE INDUSTRY. STARTING IN 2000, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS HAS ALSO MADE INVESTMENTS IN HEALTH CARE RELATED COMPANIES, TYPICALLY INVESTING IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.   IN 2009, KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS CREATED A FUND, KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES, LLC - SERIES A, WHICH IS A SERIES LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY UNDER DELAWARE LAW, AND THROUGH WHICH IT MAKES INVESTMENTS IN HEALTH CARE RELATED COMPANIES, AGAIN TYPICALLY IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.  IN 2010, KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC - SERIES B WAS FORMED TO FACILITATE THE INVESTMENT BY ENTITIES OTHER THAN KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS AND THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES.  KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES - SERIES A AND SERIES B INVEST IN TANDEM, AND, AS NOTED ABOVE, TYPICALLY INVEST IN TANDEM WITH THE PF INVESTMENT SERIES. THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC AND KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC EACH HAVE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEES, IN THE CASE OF THE PERMANENTE FEDERATION LLC WHOSE MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY THE MEMBERS OF SERIES A, AND IN THE CASE OF KAISER PERMANENTE VENTURES LLC WHOSE MEMBERS ARE APPOINTED BY KAISER FOUNDATION HOSPITALS.  THESE COMMITTEES ACT UPON INVESTMENT RECOMMENDATIONS OF NVD STAFF.

WITH REGARDS TO Q10 OF SECTION 7A FOR AEW EUROPE, THE FIRM HAS A STATUS OF "CONSEILLER EN INVESTISSEMENTS FINANCIERS". IT IS REQUIRED UNDER FRENCH LAW TO REGISTER WITH AN SRO. THE SRO IS CALLED  CHAMBRE NATIONALE DES CONSEILLERS EN INVESTISSEMENTS FINANCIERS. THE SRO'S ARE REGULATED BY THE "AUTORITE DES MARCHES FINANCIERS" ("AMF"). 6. THE ADVISER IS AN INDIRECT SUBSIDIARY OF NATIXIS GLOBAL ASSET MANAGEMENT, AN INTERNATIONAL ASSET MANAGEMENT GROUP BASED IN PARIS, FRANCE.  THE ADVISER HAS A SUPPLEMENTARY LIST, WHICH IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST, OF ITS "RELATED PERSONS" THAT ARE INVESTMENT ADVISERS OR BROKER-DEALERS WHO ARE NOT LISTED ON SECTION 7.A OF THIS SCHEDULE D.  A  RELATED ADVISER OR BROKER-DEALER IS NOT LISTED IN SECTION 7.A. OF THIS SCHEDULE D IF (I) THE ADVISER HAS NO BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH THE RELATED ADVISER OR BROKER-DEALER; (II) THE ADVISER DOES NOT CONDUCT JOINT OPERATIONS WITH THE  RELATED ADVISER OR BROKER-DEALER; (III) THE ADVISER DOES NOT PROVIDE ADVICE THAT IS FORMULATED (IN WHOLE OR IN PART) BY THE RELATED ADVISER OR BROKER-DEALER; (IV) THE ADVISER DOES NOT SHARE ANY SUPERVISED PERSONS OR PREMISES WITH THE RELATED ADVISER OR BROKER DEALER AND (V) THE RELATED ADVISER OR BROKER-DEALER DOES NOT PRESENT A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH THE ADVISER'S CLIENTS.   THE ADVISER HAS RELATED PERSONS THAT ARE REGISTERED AS INVESTMENT ADVISERS WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION AND WHICH SERVE AS GENERAL PARTNERS OF LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS AND MANAGERS OF LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES NOT LISTED IN SECTION 7.A. OF THIS SCHEDULE D.  COMPLETE AND ACCURATE INFORMATION ABOUT THOSE LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS AND LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES IS AVAILABLE IN THE FORM ADV OF THOSE INVESTMENT ADVISERS.  TO THE ADVISER'S KNOWLEDGE, NONE OF THE ADVISER'S CLIENTS ARE SOLICITED TO INVEST IN ANY OF THOSE LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS OR LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES.  CERTAIN NON-CONTROLLING HOLDERS OF BPCE: BPCE IS OWNED BY BANKS COMPRISING TWO AUTONOMOUS AND COMPLEMENTARY RETAIL BANKING NETWORKS CONSISTING OF THE CAISSE D'EPARGNE REGIONAL SAVINGS BANKS AND THE BANQUE POPULAIRE REGIONAL COOPERATIVE BANKS. 7. Note 1: Lobo Baya, LLC, an affiliate of the Adviser and listed in Section 7.A of Schedule D was previously registered as an Exempt Reporting Adviser with the SEC.  Effective 3/31/2014 Lobo Baya filed an ADV W as it no-longer advises a private fund and is not required to be registered with the SEC.   We believe Lobo Baya should still be included as an affiliate.  However, in order for Lobo Baya to appear in Section 7.A of Schedule D, we needed to suppress both its SEC number and CRD number, which are 802-75729 and 162417 respectively.   This was necessary because whenever an SEC 802 number is listed the IARD system requires Section 7.A.5.(b) to be checked indicating other investment adviser.   Lobo Baya is no longer an investment adviser.   We also needed to suppress Lobo Bayas CRD number as the IARD system currently (as of the date of this filing) has Lobo Bayas CRD number affiliated with an investment adviser.

Partners Group AG together with each Relying ERA are completing a single Form ADV based upon an interpretation of the SEC staff's position expressed in the 2012 ABA no-action letter.  With respect to the response in Section 2.B being $0, this marks a change from the previous response of $80,118,287 in that neither Partners Group AG nor any of the Relying ERAs included in this form manage private fund assets at a place of business in the United States.  With respect to the private funds listed in Section 7.B.(1) that are specifically identified as being organized under the laws of the United Kingdom, please note that these are Scottish limited partnerships governed by Scottish law; as the form does not permit Scotland to be listed as a jurisdiction, United Kingdom is chosen instead.  With respect to private funds listed in Section 7.B.(1) that have two auditors listed in response to question 23, please note that PricewaterhouseCoopers CI LLP audits these funds in accordance with IFRS standards, while PricewaterhouseCoopers AG conducts an audit of these funds pursuant to US GAAP standards.  With respect to the question of whether listed individuals on Schedule A are control persons, as that term is defined in the instructions to Schedule A, the directors of the general partners located in Guernsey and the managers of the Luxembourg management companies listed in Schedule A have answered N as this is the case with respect to the lead filer, Partners Group AG.  However, these individuals are control persons of the general partners located in Guernsey and management companies located in Luxembourg, respectively.

All disclosures in this Form ADV, Part 1A have been made with respect to the London Branch of DVB Bank SE (London Branch), and not with respect to DVB Bank SE, unless specifically provided otherwise. All of the investment advisory activities with respect to which this Form ADV, Part 1A has been filed are conducted solely by the London Branch. The London Branch has its sole office and place of business at Park House, 16-18 Finsbury Circus, 6th Floor, London EC2M 7EB, United Kingdom, and is registered with and regulated by the U.K. Financial Conduct Authority.  The qualifying private funds (as defined in Rule 203(m)-1(d)(5) under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, as amended) advised by the London Branch in connection with which this Form ADV, Part 1A has been filed rely on an exclusion from the definition of investment company under section 3 of the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (1940 Act), other than those provided by sections 3(c)(1) and 3(c)(7) of that Act.  Consistent with SEC guidance to date, however, such entities have been treated as private funds for purposes of this filing.  Accordingly, Item 7.B of this form has been answered Yes and a private fund report on Schedule D, Section 7.B.(1), has been completed for each such entity.  In addition, because in order to submit this filing we are required to answer Question #4 of Section 7.B(1) of Schedule D for each such entity, we selected choice (2) for reliance on section 3(c)(7) of the 1940 Act, even though, as mentioned above in this Miscellaneous section, such entities rely on an investment company exclusion under the 1940 Act other than section 3(c)(1) and section 3(c)(7).  In answering Question #12 of Section 7.B(1) of Schedule D for each such entity, we inserted $0 because there is no required minimum investment for such entities; rather, the applicable investment commitment is negotiated on a case-by-case basis with each investor.

Schedule D, Section 7.B.(1), Question 28, Marketers, requires clarification.  The answer to 28(c), name of the marketer, should be: Boenning & Scattergood, Inc.  The answer to 28(b), SEC file number, should be 8-15543.  When this information is inputed into the electronic Form ADV, the system automatically changes the answers to 1914 Advisors and 801-68111.  This is because 1914 Advisors is the investment advisor affiliate of Boenning & Scattergood, Inc., a broker-dealer, and that they both have the same CRD number of 100.  The system recognizes that CRD number 100 belongs to 1914 Advisors and automatically changes the answers for the name of the marketer and the SEC file number.  FINRA IARD instructs that there is no way to override the electronic system when answering this question.  FINRA IARD further instructs to supplement the filing of the Form ARD with this explanation.

Item 1.L: AngelList Advisors, LLC (the "AngelList Advisors") has no website.  The website www.angel.co is operated by AngelList, LLC, AngelList Advisors' parent company.  Schedule D Section 7.B(1)(A)(18): Certain funds managed by AngelList may be formed to invest alongside a seasoned angel investor (each, a "Lead Angel").  The Lead Angel will perform certain limited investment services for the relevant fund, including informing AngelList Advisors how the Lead Angel intends to vote proxies, and when and how the Lead Angel intends to exit its investment in an underlying portfolio company.  In return for these services, a Lead Angel may receive a carried interest with respect to the relevant funds.  Currently, the Lead Angels may be registered with the SEC as exempt reporting advisers, registered with a state as investment advisers, or not registered in any capacity as their assets under management are so low so as not to trigger a registration obligation with any regulatory authority.  It is intended that, going forward, AngelList Advisors will engage certain or all Lead Angels as independent contractors with respect to the particular funds for which they serve as Lead Angel.  In their role as independent contractor they will provide AngelList with limited information about its intention to purchase or dispose of an interest in an underlying portfolio company, however, AngelList Advisors will make any ultimate decision as investment manager to the Funds.    Schedule D Section 7.B(1)(A)(25): Investors invest in the private funds managed by AngelList Advisors through the angel.co website.  Bancbox performs certain custodial services for the funds by facilitating the electronic investment by investors through the website, but has not entered into a custody agreement, or any other agreement in which is formally designated as a custodian, with AngelList Advisors or any fund.  Schedule D Section 7.B(1)(A)(28):  As discussed above, AngelList, LLC operates www.angel.co the site through which investors invest in the private funds managed by AngelList Advisors.  Accordingly, while AngelList, LLC does not technically perform any marketing services for the funds, in the interest of full disclosure, we have listed AngelList, LLC in response to this item, as it operates the website through which the funds are marketed.

Spruceview Capital Partners LLC (Spruceview Capital) may be considered a related person of Jordan/Zalaznick Advisers, Inc. (JZAI) because the principals of JZAI, together with a fund managed by JZAI, have a significant ownership interest in Spruceview Capital.  However, based on guidance from the staff of the Securities and Exchange Commission, JZAI has been omitted from Section 7.A of Schedule D because Spruceview Capital and JZAI each believe that there is no business relationship between Spruceview Capital and JZAI unrelated to the investment in Spruceview Capital that would create a conflict of interest between Spruceview or JZAI and their respective clients.  Moreover, Spruceview Capital and JZAI (1) have no business dealings in connection with advisory services to their respective clients; (2) do not conduct shared operations; (3) do not refer clients or business to, or receive referrals from, each other; (4) do not share supervised persons; and (5) have no reason to believe that their relationship otherwise creates a conflict of interest with their respective clients.  Spruceview Capital intends to sub-lease space from JZAI in New York for its secondary office.

Certain changes with regards to the management of the private fund, Rubicon Master Fund (identification no. 805-5214342335)and its feeder funds, Rubicon Global Fund and Rubicon Global Partners, L.P. (the "Funds") will take effect on July 1st, 2014.  Rubicon Fund Management (Jersey) Limited ("RFMJ") has recently been incorporated in Jersey, Channel Islands and has been authorized by the Jersey Financial Services Commission ("JFSC")to carry on Fund Services Business for the Funds.  Rubicon Fund Management Limited (the "Cayman Manager") will appoint RFMJ as the Investment Manager under the terms of a new Investment Management Agreement.  RFMJ will in turn, under the terms of a Portfolio Management Agreement, appoint Rubicon Fund Management LLP ("RFM LLP") to undertake portfolio management and related services for the Fund.  RFMJ's primary functions will be Risk Management, a portion of the overall portfolio management for the Fund and, in addition, the oversight of its delegate, RFM LLP.  No changes are proposed to the persons undertaking the trading activity. In preparation for these changes, Horace Joseph Leitch, COO and managing member of RFM LLP as of the fiscal year end (March 31st, 2014), became CEO of RFMJ on June 1st, 2014.  Andrew Bloomfield became COO of RFM LLP on June 1st, 2014. We have completed this annual updating amendment to reflect the above changes as they take effect on July 1st, 2014.

EACH OF THE AMG AFFILIATES, INCLUDING PANTHEON, OPERATES AUTONOMOUSLY AND INDEPENDENTLY OF AMG AND OF EACH OTHER.  EXCEPT AS DESCRIBED IN THIS FORM ADV, WE DO NOT HAVE ANY BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH THESE AMG AFFILIATES AND DO NOT CONDUCT JOINT OPERATIONS WITH THEM. THE AMG AFFILIATES DOES NOT FORMULATE ADVICE FOR PANTHEONS CLIENTS AND DO NOT, IN OUR VIEW, PRESENT ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH OUR CLIENTS. SECTION 2.B.: THE AMOUNT OF PRIVATE FUND ASSETS MANAGED IN THE UNITED STATES IS $0. WITH RESPECT TO DUCHESS I CDO SA, DUCHESS III CDO SA, DUCHESS IV CLO BV, DUCHESS V CLO BV, DUCHESS VI CLO BV, DUCHESS VII CLO BV, FUGU CLO BV, MALIN CLO BV AND ROCKALL CLO BV (THE "SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS"), THE PERCENTAGE OF INVESTORS AND NUMBER OF BENEFICIAL OWNERS IS UNKNOWN (OTHER THAN OWNERSHIP BY OUR AFFILIATE, WHICH WE HAVE NOTED AS ONE BENEFICIAL OWNER FOR THESE PURPOSES). FURTHERMORE, REGARDING SUCH FUNDS AND FOR PURPOSES OF THESE CALCULATIONS, WE HAVE AGGREGATED ALL TRANCHES OF INTERESTS ISSUED BY SUCH FUNDS. WITH RESPECT TO THE SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS WE HAVE CALCULATED GROSS ASSETS ON THE BASIS OF THE BALANCE SHEETS OF SUCH FUNDS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGE HELD BY OUR AFFILIATE IN EACH SUCH FUND USING THE PAR VALUE OF THE NOTES HELD BY IT DIVIDED BY THE TOTAL PAR VALUE OF THE OUTSTANDING NOTES ISSUED BY THE RELEVANT FUND. WITH RESPECT TO ALMACK I MEZZANINE LP, ALMACK II UNLEVERAGED LP AND ALMACK MEZZANINE III LP (THE "MEZZANINE FUNDS"), WE HAVE CALCULATED THE FUNDS' RESPECTIVE GROSS ASSETS BY VALUING DEBT ASSETS AT PAR PLUS ACCRUED INTEREST LESS IMPAIRMENTS AND EQUITY INVESTMENTS USING A MULTIPLES METHODOLOGY ON THE BASIS THAT THEY ARE HELD AT FAIR VALUE. THIS IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION (IPEVC) GUIDELINES, WHICH IS THE BASIS PRESCRIBED BY THE FUND DOCUMENTS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGES HELD BY THE VARIOUS CLASSES OF OWNER IN SUCH FUNDS BY REFERENCE TO THEIR ORIGINAL COMMITMENTS. WITH RESPECT TO DEUTSCHE BANK AG, LONDON BRANCH ("DEUTSCHE BANK") LISTED IN ITEM 7.B.1 OF SCHEDULE D AS CUSTODIAN FOR CERTAIN PRIVATE FUNDS WE ADVISE, WE MAY ALSO USE VARIOUS AFFILIATES OF DEUTSCHE BANK FOR CUSTODY

AM Advisors is member of the Asociación Mexicana de Asesores de Inversión Independientes (AMAII), who performs supervisory functions to its members, instead of the Comision Nacional Bancaria y de Valores (CNBV). The AMAII is a self-regulated organization recognized by the CNBV, to act and be certified as such.   To become a member of the AMAII, the individuals who perform advisory activities in the company, must obtain a certificate as Asesor en Estrategias de Inversión from the Asociación Mexicana de Intermediarios Bursátiles ("AMIB") (this certificate is not granted to the company but to the individuals). The certificate confirms the knowledge and expertise of the individuals through the approval of tests applied by the AMIB. Its validity is for 3 years.  So, AM Advisors is recognized as an Independent Investment Advisor by the AMAII, and Juan José Domene y Pablo de Abiega are recognized as Asesor en Estrategias de Inversión by the AMIB.  AM Advisors, manages certain private funds through delegations by AM General Partner, S.A.P.I. de C.V. EACH PRIME BROKER, CUSTODIAN, MARKETER AND ADMINISTRATOR LISTED ON SCHEDULE D, SECTION 7.B.(1) WITH RESPECT TO A PARTICULAR PRIVATE FUND IS THE ENTITY WITH WHICH THE PRIVATE FUND HAS ENTERED INTO A CORE TERMS AGREEMENT OR SIMILAR AGREEMENT GOVERNING THE OVERALL RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE FUND AND SUCH SERVICE PROVIDER.  A PRIME BROKER, CUSTODIAN, MARKETER OR ADMINISTRATOR, IN FULFILLING ITS OBLIGATIONS UNDER A CORE TERMS OR SIMILAR AGREEMENT, MAY USE THE SERVICES OF ONE OR MORE AFFILIATED U.S. OR NON-U.S. ENTITIES.   THE AUDITS OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE PRIVATE FUNDS INCLUDED IN ITEM 7.B AND SECTION 7.B OF SCHEDULE D ARE PERFORMED IN ACCORDANCE WITH AUDITING STANDARDS, INCLUDING AUDITOR INDEPENDENCE STANDARDS, OF THE BRAZILIAN FEDERAL ACCOUNTING COUNCIL AND/OR THE INTERNATIONAL ETHICS AND STANDARDS BOARD OF ACCOUNTANTS. THEREFORE, RESPONSES IN ITEM 23 OF SECTION 7.B.(1) ARE PROVIDED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THOSE STANDARDS.

Although not required to be disclosed under Item 11, the adviser has elected to disclose a previous disciplinary action against the adviser by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission.    In connection with a secondary offering of shares by Japan Airlines Corporation (JAL) on the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) in July 2006, DKR Oasis (Hong Kong) LLC, the predecessor entity now known as Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC, engaged in certain trading in the shares of JAL on behalf of a client.  The Hong Kong Securities & Futures Commission (SFC) brought a disciplinary action against Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer related to these trades due to concerns that the SFC had in relation to the trading.  On September 15, 2011, Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer reached an agreement with the SFC to resolve the matter.  Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer did not admit any wrongdoing; however, they agreed to resolve the matter and accept a public reprimand and fines against them equal to a total of approximately $1,935,484.  The SFC did not find that either Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC or Mr. Fischer had breached any law or regulation in respect of their actions, and they both remain licensed in good standing with the SFC, with no limitations or restrictions on their ability to conduct regulated activities in Hong Kong.  The SFC took into account that Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer had clean disciplinary records and co-operated with the SFC.  The SFC also took into account that Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer had voluntarily taken steps, in 2007, not required by law or regulation, to reduce any similar concerns arising from their trading by imposing internal guideline, rules, and polices in relation to their trading in connection with all secondary offerings on the TSE.

IN RELIANCE ON THE SEC STAFF'S FAQ REGARDING EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISERS, THE SPE, (I) DOES NOT ENGAGE IN ANY OTHER ACTIVITIES THAT WOULD CAUSE THE SPE TO BE AN INVESTMENT ADVISER, AND (II) ACTS AS THE SPE ONLY FOR PRIVATE FUNDS OR OTHER POOLED INVESTMENT VEHICLES ADVISED BY THE REGISTRANT OR ITS RELATED PERSONS.

Eclectica Asset Management LLP ("EAM") manages funds through delegation by Eclectica Management Limited ("EML"),  a financial affiliate disclosed in Section 7A.  EML is an entity formed for tax and regulatory purposes and has no employees.  However, EML may receive a management fee or an incentive allocation and could be considered to be an investment adviser, but is not required to be separately registered as an investment adviser under the terms of the 2005 and 2012 ABA No-Action letters for the reasons listed therein and because it is a special purpose entity under the supervision and control of EAM and all of the persons acting on its behalf are associated with EAM, with the exception of any independent directors.  EAM has answered "No" to Item 8.G.(1) because it currently has no soft dollar arrangements.  However, EAM may use full service broker-dealers that provide research or other products and services to most or all of their customers, without being requested to do so, and EAM may on occasion recieve and use research provided by these broker-dealers.  Figures relating to regulatory assets under management, fund gross asset values and investor counts are as of April 30,2014.
