THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER IS THE INVESTMENT MANAGER OF COMGEST GROWTH PLC, AN OPEN-ENDED INVESTMENT COMPANY WITH VARIABLE CAPITAL ORGANISED UNDER THE LAWS OF IRELAND WHICH QUALIFIES AND IS AUTHORISED IN IRELAND BY THE CENTRAL BANK OF IRELAND AS A UCITS FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE UCITS REGULATIONS. COMGEST GROWTH PLC IS STRUCTURED AS AN UMBRELLA FUND WITH SEGREGATED LIABILITY BETWEEN FUNDS IN THAT THE SHARE CAPITAL OF THE COMPANY MAY BE DIVIDED INTO DIFFERENT CLASSES OF SHARES WITH ONE OR MORE CLASSES REPRESENTING A SEPARATE FUND OF THE COMPANY.  EACH FUND IS A SEGREGATED PORTFOLIO OF ASSETS AND WILL ACCORDINGLY BEAR ITS OWN LIABILITIES. WITH REGARD TO THIRD PARTIES, IN PARTICULAR THE COMPANY'S CREDITORS, THE COMPANY SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL LIABILITIES INCURRED BY A FUND EXCLUSIVELY OUT OF THE ASSETS OF THE RELEVANT FUND. AMONG INVESTORS, THE LIABILITIES OF EACH FUND SHALL ONLY BE INCURRED TO THE RESPECTIVE FUND. FOR PURPOSES OF ITEM 7.B., ONLY FUNDS WITH U.S. INVESTORS HAVE BEEN LISTED. COMGEST S.A. AND COMGEST FAR EAST LIMITED AS LISTED IN ITEM 7.A, ARE RELYING ON UNIBANCO LETTERS AND THE FOREIGN PRIVATE ADVISER EXEMPTION.  BOTH PROVIDE ADVICE TO THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER AND DO NOT PROVIDE ADVICE TO THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISERS' CLIENTS.  THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISERS DO NOT HAVE A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE UNITED STATES AND DO NOT DIRECTLY ADVISE ANY U.S. CLIENTS.  THE RESPECTIVE AUM OF THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISERS ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE U.S. IS ONLY WITH RESPECT TO INVESTORS IN THE NON-U.S. CLIENT FUNDS THEY ADVISE.

SCHEDULES A AND B - IFS TRUSTEES (THE "COMPANY") IS A BUSINESS BASED IN MAURITIUS, WHICH PROVIDES PROFESSIONAL TRUSTEE SERVICES. THE COMPANY ACTS AS TRUSTEE FOR VARIOUS TRUST FUNDS. EACH TRUSTEE RELATIONSHIP COMPRISES A DISCRETE SET OF OBLIGATIONS IMPOSED BY THE RELEVANT TRUST INSTRUMENT. WHEN ACTING AS TRUSTEE THE COMPANY IS REQUIRED TO ACT IN DIFFERENT CAPACITIES TO REFLECT THE SEPARATE FIDUCIARY DUTY IT OWES TO THE BENEFICIARIES OF EACH TRUST. ACCORDINGLY ANY DECISIONS TAKEN BY THE COMPANY IN ITS CAPACITY AS TRUSTEE OF EACH TRUST FUND ARE DISTINCT FROM ONE ANOTHER AND STEM FROM SEPARATE DECISION MAKING PROCESSES.

CERTAIN OF THE PRIVATE FUNDS DISCLOSED IN THIS FORM ADV (COLLECTIVELY, "CRV FUNDS") MAY UTILIZE ONE OR MORE ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENT VEHICLES AND/OR OTHER TYPES OF SPECIAL PURPOSE VEHICLES (COLLECTIVELY, "SPVS") FOR THE PURPOSE OF: (I) ADDRESSING TAX, REGULATORY AND/OR STRUCTURAL ISSUES AND (II) FACILITATING CERTAIN INVESTMENTS BY SUCH CRV FUNDS AND/OR CERTAIN INVESTORS IN SUCH CRV FUNDS.  TO AVOID ANY PERCEIVED DUPLICATION OF ASSETS, THE ASSETS OF ANY SPVS ARE INCLUDED IN THE VALUE OF TOTAL ASSETS OF THE APPLICABLE CRV FUNDS TO WHICH SUCH SPVS RELATE. ADDITIONALLY, THE INFORMATION PROVIDE IN SECTION 7.B. OF SCHEDULE D WITH RESPECT TO A CRV FUND IS, TO THE EXTENT RELEVANT, GENERALLY APPLICABLE WITH RESPECT TO ITS RELATED SPVS (IF ANY).  CONSEQUENTLY, THE SPVS HAVE NOT BEEN IDENTIFIED SEPARATELY IN SECTION 7.B. OF SCHEDULE D.

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS DELEGATED ITS (1) FUND DISTRIBUTION FUNCTIONS TO AFFILIATED ENTITIES AND (2) INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT AND OTHER FUNCTIONS TO THIRD PARTIES AND OVERSEES THOSE DELEGATIONS.  7.A) REGISTRANT MAINTAINS A SUPPLEMENTARY LIST OF RELATED PERSONS WHO ARE NOT LISTED IN SECTION 7.A BECAUSE (1) REGISTRANT HAS NO BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH THE RELATED PERSON IN CONNECTION WITH ADVISORY SERVICES IT PROVIDES TO ITS CLIENTS; (2) REGISTRANT DOES NOT CONDUCT SHARED OPERATIONS WITH THE RELATED PERSON; (3) REGISTRANT DOES NOT REFER CLIENTS OR BUSINESS TO THE RELATED PERSON, AND THE RELATED PERSON DOES NOT REFER PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS OR BUSINESS TO REGISTRANT; (4) REGISTRANT DOES NOT SHARE SUPERVISED PERSONS OR PREMISES WITH THE RELATED PERSON; AND (5) REGISTRANT HAS NO REASON TO BELIEVE THAT ITS RELATIONSHIP WITH THE RELATED PERSON OTHERWISE CREATES A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH ITS CLIENTS. A COPY OF THIS SUPPLEMENTARY LIST WILL BE PROVIDED UPON REQUEST.
REGARDING SECTION 7.B.(1) - QUESTION 23.(A)(2), THE PRIVATE FUNDS' FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PREPARED IN ACCORDANCE WITH INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL REPORTING STANDARDS (IFRS).

MONEDA CORREDORA DE BOLSA LTDA (MCB) IS A REGISTERED BROKER-DEALER WITH THE CHILEAN SECURITIES REGULATOR (SVS, SUPERINTENDENCY OF SECURITIES AND INSURANCE). IT OFFERS BROKERAGE  SERVICES ONLY IN CHILE AND WITH RESPECT TO CHILEAN SECURITIES. MCB CARRIES OUT CUSTODIAN SERVICES  OF LOCAL SECURITIES. MCB'S SCOPE OF ACTION AS A BROKER-DEALER IS STRICTLY LIMITED TO CHILE AND TO CHILEAN SECURITIES TRADED ON THE SANTIAGO STOCK EXCHANGE. CLIENTS OF THE ADVISOR ARE NOT ALLOWED TO TRADE WITH THIS ENTITY.

SECTION 2.B.: THE AMOUNT OF PRIVATE FUND ASSETS MANAGED IN THE UNITED STATES IS $0. WITH RESPECT TO DUCHESS I CDO SA, DUCHESS III CDO SA, DUCHESS IV CLO BV, DUCHESS V CLO BV, DUCHESS VI CLO BV, DUCHESS VII CLO BV, FUGU CLO BV, MALIN CLO BV AND ROCKALL CLO BV (THE "SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS"), THE PERCENTAGE OF INVESTORS AND NUMBER OF BENEFICIAL OWNERS IS UNKNOWN (OTHER THAN OWNERSHIP BY OUR AFFILIATE, WHICH WE HAVE NOTED AS ONE BENEFICIAL OWNER FOR THESE PURPOSES). FURTHERMORE, REGARDING SUCH FUNDS AND FOR PURPOSES OF THESE CALCULATIONS, WE HAVE AGGREGATED ALL TRANCHES OF INTERESTS ISSUED BY SUCH FUNDS. WITH RESPECT TO THE SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS WE HAVE CALCULATED GROSS ASSETS ON THE BASIS OF THE BALANCE SHEETS OF SUCH FUNDS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGE HELD BY OUR AFFILIATE IN EACH SUCH FUND USING THE PAR VALUE OF THE NOTES HELD BY IT DIVIDED BY THE TOTAL PAR VALUE OF THE OUTSTANDING NOTES ISSUED BY THE RELEVANT FUND. WITH RESPECT TO ALMACK I MEZZANINE LP, ALMACK II UNLEVERAGED LP AND ALMACK MEZZANINE III LP (THE "MEZZANINE FUNDS"), WE HAVE CALCULATED THE FUNDS' RESPECTIVE GROSS ASSETS BY VALUING DEBT ASSETS AT PAR PLUS ACCRUED INTEREST LESS IMPAIRMENTS AND EQUITY INVESTMENTS USING A MULTIPLES METHODOLOGY ON THE BASIS THAT THEY ARE HELD AT FAIR VALUE. THIS IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION (IPEVC) GUIDELINES, WHICH IS THE BASIS PRESCRIBED BY THE FUND DOCUMENTS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGES HELD BY THE VARIOUS CLASSES OF OWNER IN SUCH FUNDS BY REFERENCE TO THEIR ORIGINAL COMMITMENTS. WITH RESPECT TO DEUTSCHE BANK AG, LONDON BRANCH ("DEUTSCHE BANK") LISTED IN ITEM 7.B.1 OF SCHEDULE D AS CUSTODIAN FOR CERTAIN PRIVATE FUNDS WE ADVISE, WE MAY ALSO USE VARIOUS AFFILIATES OF DEUTSCHE BANK FOR CUSTODY

Mr. Foster wishes to file, and has attempted to file, a Final Report on Form ADV (the Final Report).  However, the IARD website has not accepted such Final Report.  Specifically, Mr. Foster has received a message via the Completeness Check on the IARD website that Section 7.B(1)-20 of Schedule D (Question 20) of Mr. Fosters previously filed Form ADV exempt reporting adviser filing (the Current Filing) now requires a response, although having been previously accepted via the IARD website.  FINRA was contacted telephonically on 12/9/14 and 12/10/14 to learn how to proceed.  FINRA informed that in order to file a Final Report, given the recent addition of Question 20 as a required field in the Completeness Check, that Mr. Foster would need to first amend his Current Filing so as to provide a response to Question 20, and then proceed with filing his Final Report.  In light of the foregoing, Mr. Foster is filing this Other-than-Annual Amendment (this Amendment) for the sole purpose of responding to Question 20 so as to enable Mr. Foster to file a Final Report on Form ADV.  Accordingly, Mr. Foster is updating only Question 20 in the Current Filing.  Mr. Foster intends to file a Final Report on Form ADV as soon as reasonably practicable after filing the Amendment.

THE APPLICANT IS A WHOLLY OWNED SUBSIDIARY OF THE ROYAL BANK OF SCOTLAND PLC, WHICH IN TURN IS OWNED BY THE ROYAL BANK OF SCOTLAND GROUP PLC ("RBS"), A PUBLICLY TRADED COMPANY IN THE UNITED KINGDOM.  THE DIRECT AND INDIRECT SUBSIDIARIES OF RBS ARE ENGAGED IN OPERATIONS THAT SPAN RETAIL BANKING, CORPORATE AND COMMERCIAL BANKING, FINANCIAL MARKETS ACTIVITIES, WEALTH MANAGEMENT, INSURANCE AND ASSET MANAGEMENT.  HOWEVER, THE APPLICANT CONDUCTS ITS OPERATIONS SEPARATELY FROM THE OTHER DIVISIONS AND UNITS OF RBS.  THE APPLICANT IS AFFILIATED WITH NUMEROUS ENTITIES THAT ENGAGE IN FINANCIAL SERVICES ACTIVITIES.  CERTAIN OF THESE ENTITIES MAY BE SUBJECT TO CERTAIN DISCIPLINARY EVENTS PURSUANT TO ITEM 11. DETAILS OF THE MATERIAL LITIGATION AND INVESTIGATIONS AFFECTING THE RBS GROUP AND ITS MEMBERS CAN BE FOUND IN THE RBS GROUP FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, PUBLISHED QUARTERLY AT HTTP://WWW.INVESTORS.RBS.COM/RESULTS-CENTRE/ARCHIVED-GROUP-RESULTS/2013.ASPX.  EACH DISCLOSURE ON LITIGATION AND INVESTIGATIONS CAN BE FOUND BY SEARCHING THE PHRASE "LITIGATION, INVESTIGATIONS." NO SUCH DISCIPLINARY EVENTS ARE IN CONNECTION WITH THE ACTIVITIES OR BUSINESS OF THE APPLICANT OR ITS SUPERVISED PERSONS.  THE APPLICANT IS REQUIRED BY FORM ADV TO ENTER AN AMOUNT OF AT LEAST US $1 IN SCHEDULE D, SECTION 2B; HOWEVER, AS THE APPLICANT DOES NOT HAVE A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE UNITED STATES, IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY PRIVATE ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT "IN THE UNITED STATES."  THE APPLICANT ADVISES SEVERAL INVESTMENT FUNDS THAT ARE PUBLICLY OFFERED OUTSIDE OF THE U.S. AND THAT ARE REGISTERED WITH VARIOUS FOREIGN FINANCIAL AUTHORITIES.  THESE FUNDS WERE NOT PUBLICLY OFFERED IN THE U.S. AND ANY U.S. INVESTORS WERE NOT RESIDENT IN THE U.S. AT THE TIME OF SALE.  ALL SUCH FUNDS COMPLY WITH 3(C)(1) OF THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT AND APPLICABLE SEC GUIDANCE.

COMGEST GROWTH PLC IS STRUCTURED AS AN UMBRELLA FUND WITH SEGREGATED LIABILITY BETWEEN FUNDS IN THAT THE SHARE CAPITAL OF THE COMPANY MAY BE DIVIDED INTO DIFFERENT CLASSES OF SHARES WITH ONE OR MORE CLASSES REPRESENTING A SEPARATE SUB-FUND OF THE COMPANY.  EACH SUB-FUND IS A SEGREGATED PORTFOLIO OF ASSETS AND WILL ACCORDINGLY BEAR ITS OWN LIABILITIES. WITH REGARD TO THIRD PARTIES, IN PARTICULAR THE COMPANY'S CREDITORS, THE COMPANY IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL LIABILITIES INCURRED BY A SUB-FUND EXCLUSIVELY OUT OF THE ASSETS OF THE RELEVANT SUB-FUND. AMONG INVESTORS, THE LIABILITIES OF EACH SUB-FUND SHALL ONLY BE INCURRED TO THE RESPECTIVE SUB-FUND. FOR PURPOSES OF ITEM 7.B., ONLY SUB-FUNDS WITH U.S. INVESTORS HAVE BEEN LISTED. COMGEST S.A. AND COMGEST FAR EAST LIMITED AS LISTED IN ITEM 7.A, ARE RELYING ON UNIBANCO LETTERS AND THE FOREIGN PRIVATE ADVISER EXEMPTION.  BOTH PROVIDE ADVICE TO THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER AND DO NOT PROVIDE ADVICE TO THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER'S CLIENTS.  THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER DOES NOT HAVE A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THE UNITED STATES AND DOES NOT DIRECTLY ADVISE ANY U.S. CLIENTS.  WITH RESPECT TO QUESTIONS IN SCHEDULE D, SECTION 7.B., ITEMS 13 THROUGH 16, THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER HAS COMPILED THE ANSWERS IN REFERENCE TO INFORMATION AVAILABLE TO IT THROUGH ITS PROPRIETARY SYSTEMS AND THE RELEVANT SUB-FUND'S REGISTER OF SHAREHOLDERS AS OF THE END OF THE EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER'S FINANCIAL YEAR.

Item 1. Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and its relying adviser, Oasis Management Company Ltd., are filing a single Form ADV in reliance on the position expressed in the SEC staff's no-action letter to the American Bar Association dated January 18, 2012.  Item 11. Although not required to be disclosed under Item 11, the Adviser has elected to disclose a previous disciplinary action against the Adviser by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission ("SFC").    On September 15, 2011, in relation to equity orders placed on July 19, 2006 in the shares of Japan Airlines Corporation on the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE), the SFC announced that it had reached an agreement with Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Seth Fischer to resolve a disciplinary action related to the orders.  Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer agreed to accept a public reprimand and fine against them, which the SFC regarded as sufficient expiation for their concerns.  The SFC did not find that either Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC or Mr. Fischer had breached any law or regulation in respect of their actions, and took into account that Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer had voluntarily taken steps, in 2007, not required by law or regulation, to reduce any similar concerns arising from their trading by imposing internal guidelines in relation to their trading in connection with all secondary offerings on the TSE.  Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer remain licensed in good standing with the SFC with no limitations or restrictions on their ability to conduct regulated activities in Hong Kong or to trade on the TSE.  No Oasis fund investor bore any portion of the fine paid by Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC or Mr. Fischer.  Further details can be found at www.sfc.hk.

EACH OF THESE THREE FUNDS WITHDREW SUBSTANTIALLY ALL OF THEIR INVESTMENT IN RPM METROPOLITAN FUND, LP AND BEGAN MAKING DIRECT INVESTMENTS.  HOWEVER, A PORTION OF EACH OF THESE THREE FUNDS INTERESTS WERE LEFT IN RPM METROPOLITAN FUND, LP AS A SIDE-POCKETED INVESTMENT ON BEHALF OF CERTAIN OF THEIR INVESTORS. WITH RESPECT TO DUCHESS I CDO SA, DUCHESS III CDO SA, DUCHESS IV CLO BV, DUCHESS V CLO BV, DUCHESS VI CLO BV, DUCHESS VII CLO BV, FUGU CLO BV, MALIN CLO BV AND ROCKALL CLO BV (THE "SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS"), THE PERCENTAGE OF INVESTORS AND NUMBER OF BENEFICIAL OWNERS IS UNKNOWN (OTHER THAN OWNERSHIP BY OUR AFFILIATE, WHICH WE HAVE NOTED AS ONE BENEFICIAL OWNER FOR THESE PURPOSES). FURTHERMORE, REGARDING SUCH FUNDS AND FOR PURPOSES OF THESE CALCULATIONS, WE HAVE AGGREGATED ALL TRANCHES OF INTERESTS ISSUED BY SUCH FUNDS. WITH RESPECT TO THE SECURITIZED ASSET FUNDS WE HAVE CALCULATED GROSS ASSETS ON THE BASIS OF THE BALANCE SHEETS OF SUCH FUNDS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGE HELD BY OUR AFFILIATE IN EACH SUCH FUND USING THE PAR VALUE OF THE NOTES HELD BY IT DIVIDED BY THE TOTAL PAR VALUE OF THE OUTSTANDING NOTES ISSUED BY THE RELEVANT FUND. WITH RESPECT TO ALMACK I MEZZANINE LP, ALMACK II UNLEVERAGED LP AND ALMACK MEZZANINE III LP (THE "MEZZANINE FUNDS"), WE HAVE CALCULATED THE FUNDS' RESPECTIVE GROSS ASSETS BY VALUING DEBT ASSETS AT PAR PLUS ACCRUED INTEREST LESS IMPAIRMENTS AND EQUITY INVESTMENTS USING A MULTIPLES METHODOLOGY ON THE BASIS THAT THEY ARE HELD AT FAIR VALUE. THIS IS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE INTERNATIONAL PRIVATE EQUITY AND VENTURE CAPITAL VALUATION (IPEVC) GUIDELINES, WHICH IS THE BASIS PRESCRIBED BY THE FUND DOCUMENTS. WE HAVE CALCULATED THE OWNERSHIP PERCENTAGES HELD BY THE VARIOUS CLASSES OF OWNER IN SUCH FUNDS BY REFERENCE TO THEIR ORIGINAL COMMITMENTS. WITH RESPECT TO DEUTSCHE BANK AG, LONDON BRANCH ("DEUTSCHE BANK") LISTED IN ITEM 7.B.1 OF SCHEDULE D AS CUSTODIAN FOR CERTAIN PRIVATE FUNDS WE ADVISE, WE MAY ALSO USE VARIOUS AFFILIATES OF DEUTSCHE BANK FOR CUSTODY

Item 1. Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and its relying adviser, Oasis Management Company Ltd., are filing a single Form ADV in reliance on the position expressed in the SEC staff's no-action letter to the American Bar Association dated January 18, 2012.  Item 11. Although not required to be disclosed under Item 11, the Adviser has elected to disclose a previous disciplinary action against the Adviser by the Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission ("SFC").    On September 15, 2011, in relation to equity orders placed on July 19, 2006 in the shares of Japan Airlines Corporation on the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE), the SFC announced that it had reached an agreement with Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Seth Fischer to resolve a disciplinary action related to the orders.  Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer agreed to accept a public reprimand and fine against them, which the SFC regarded as sufficient expiation for their concerns.  The SFC did not find that either Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC or Mr. Fischer had breached any law or regulation in respect of their actions, and took into account that Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer had voluntarily taken steps, in 2007, not required by law or regulation, to reduce any similar concerns arising from their trading by imposing internal guidelines in relation to their trading in connection with all secondary offerings on the TSE.  Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC and Mr. Fischer remain licensed in good standing with the SFC with no limitations or restrictions on their ability to conduct regulated activities in Hong Kong or to trade on the TSE.  No Oasis fund investor bore any portion of the fine paid by Oasis Management (Hong Kong) LLC or Mr. Fischer.  Further details can be found at www.sfc.hk.

AM Advisors is member of the Asociación Mexicana de Asesores de Inversión Independientes (AMAII), who performs supervisory functions to its members, instead of the Comision Nacional Bancaria y de Valores (CNBV). The AMAII is a self-regulated organization recognized by the CNBV, to act and be certified as such.   To become a member of the AMAII, the individuals who perform advisory activities in the company, must obtain a certificate as Asesor en Estrategias de Inversión from the Asociación Mexicana de Intermediarios Bursátiles ("AMIB") (this certificate is not granted to the company but to the individuals). The certificate confirms the knowledge and expertise of the individuals through the approval of tests applied by the AMIB. Its validity is for 3 years.  So, AM Advisors is recognized as an Independent Investment Advisor by the AMAII, and Juan José Domene y Pablo de Abiega are recognized as Asesor en Estrategias de Inversión by the AMIB.  AM Advisors, manages certain private funds through delegations by AM General Partner, S.A.P.I. de C.V. ("AM General Partner") which is a special purpose vehicle set up to act as general partner of certain private funds and is listed as a financial affiliate in Schedule D, 7.A. as a general partner. Because AM General Partner may receive management fees/compensation and an incentive allocation it may be considered to be an investment adviser, but is not required to separately register as an investment adviser under the terms of the 2005 and 2013 ABA No-Action Letters for the reasons listed therein and because it is an entity under the supervision and control of the filing adviser and all of the persons acting on its behalf are associated with the filing adviser.

*** Investments in the Adelis Equity Partners Fund I AB (Master Fund) are made by way of instruments called principal-linked participating loans under local Swedish law.  These instruments function in all material respects like limited partnerships in traditional private equity funds, and, accordingly, the information provided about the Master Fund in this ADV relates to the investors in the fund.  However, the legal owners of the Master Fund under Swedish law are the employee shareholders of the fund, and not the investors.  Investments in the Adelis Equity Partners Fund I Feeder SA fund (Feeder Fund) and the Adelis Friends & Family I AB fund (Friends & Family Fund) are made by way of traditional private equity instruments.  *** The financial statements of the Master Fund and the Friends & Family Fund are prepared in accordance with Swedish GAAP, and the financial statements of the Feeder Fund are prepared in accordance with Luxembourg GAAP.

UNTIL THERE IS A PREFERRED RETURN TO ALL THE INVESTORS IN THE PRIVATE EQUITY FUND, THE CARRIED INTEREST PARTNERSHIP IS NOT ENTITLED TO ANY OF THIS PROFIT SHARE). WE HAVE NOT INCLUDED THESE INTERESTS IN THE CALCULATION OF THE BENEFICIAL INTEREST OWNED BY OUR RELATED PARTIES BECAUSE THE ENTITLEMENT ONLY ARISES AFTER THE INVESTORS IN THESE FUNDS HAVE RECEIVED BACK THEIR INVESTED MONIES AND, IN THE CASE OF EACH OF THE 20% INTERESTS, A FURTHER PREFERRED RETURN.

TO AVOID ANY PERCEIVED DUPLICATION OF ASSETS, THE ASSETS OF ANY SPVS ARE INCLUDED IN THE VALUE OF TOTAL ASSETS OF THE APPLICABLE COLUMBIA FUNDS TO WHICH SUCH SPVS RELATE.
